Strong understanding of high-speed serial interfaces
Solid programming skills (C, C++, Python, Perl)
Experience using lab equipment: high speed oscilloscopes, logic and protocol analyzers, spectrum analyzers, etc.
Interest in and understanding of machine learning
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Tenstorrent offers a highly competitive compensation package and benefits, and we are an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Technical Lead, Computer Vision Engineer - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Halodi Robotics is bringing robots out of factories and into the human world. We have cracked the code and engineered a safe, capable, and affordable solution (named EVE) that will be deployed in the immediate future to security, retail, and the food-packaging markets.
Inspired by innovation and serving the greater good, Halodi Robotics intends to produce thousands of humanoid robots by 2023—and that’s just the beginning. With the mission to bring humanoid robots to everyone, Halodi Robotics offers one of the most futuristic, world-changing career opportunities of our time. And with a team that enjoys being social outside of work, collaboration and support of Halodians extends well beyond the 9 to 5.
This is the place where people come to live and work to their full potential. Halodians are passionate about seeing the human-robot world come to fruition and embrace our holistic approach to building robots—all components of our robots are developed in-house including: motors, transmissions, sensors, electronics, controls, and AI. There are not many places where you can touch every aspect of such an advanced technology, but with Halodi Robotics’ modern approach, nothing is off-limits
What You’ll Get By Joining Our Team
You can shape the future of humanoid robots.
You will have the autonomy to improve all aspects of your technical skills.
You’ll join an agile and diverse, global team.
What You'll Do
We are looking for a Senior Computer Vision Engineer to assist us in developing our next-generation sensors and vision systems for our humanoid robots. Working closely with our R&D, hardware, and software engineering teams, you will be responsible for leading the design, development, and integration of the sensors and vision systems. An ideal candidate is someone who is a multi-disciplinary engineer with experience in on-device computer vision and machine perception technologies.
Responsibilities:
Balance research and product to deliver the highest quality, state-of-the-art experiences, innovating through the full stack
Partner with cross-functional teams to influence what brings our vision to life and into customers hands
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to help inform and influence architecture during the design phase according to requirements
Requirements:
A master's degree or higher (or equivalent industry experience) in computer vision, or related fields
5+ years of relevant industry experience
Strong knowledge of the state-of-the-art in computer vision algorithms and techniques with a solid understanding of underlying sensing technologies
Solid understanding of state-of-the-art capabilities and design of sensing and compute architectures
Track record of designing complex computer vision sensing HW and SW architectures
Added Bonuses:
Experience with programming (e.g., Python, C/C++, Java), ROS2, or Unity/C#
Experience with VR/XR systems
Industrial or research experience in robotics, especially with NASA, JPL, IHMC, or TRI
Experience with motors, motor drivers, controls, and embedded systems
"With these collaborative robots–these more holistic robotics if you will–you’re trying to create a new world. You’re trying to create a human-robot world; one where interactions become the primary driver of the application.”
- Nicholas, Project Director
Stay in The Loop:
Halodi Robotics is the place where abstract ideas become reality—and even faster than you’d expect.
Stay informed of all things Halodi Robotics before anyone else by joining our Talent Network. Click here to join.
Halodi Robotics is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are given consideration regardless of race, religion, colour, gender, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class as provided in applicable employment laws. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at recruiting (at) halodi (dot) com.

Title: Electrical Engineer - Halifax, NS - Indeed.com
Description:
Put your Career in Motion with JTEKT North America!
We are seeking talented technicians and engineers to collaborate with us. JTEKT strives to provide value that exceeds customer expectations by creating exceptional products while we build excellent professionals who think and act autonomously. In turn, we are able to produce world class products and services to shape a better future.
Why you’ll love working with JTEKT:
Healthy work- life balance–
Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
Be a part of innovative projects
Engage in a challenging technological environment
Opportunities to advance your career on a local and global scale
Competitive total rewards package
Success sharing incentives available
People centered – value inclusivity and diversity
Projects and typical work:
Hardware and/or software design - including schematic and code reviews, unit testing and integration testing to verify hardware and software against the design specifications.
Develop and maintain a responsive and cooperative working relationship with internal and external customers including automotive OEMs.
Work with customers to define requirements and help develop full project timelines with major milestones.
Analyze customer requirements and specifications to identify or create hardware and/or software requirements along with test plans, procedures, and reports.
Define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions to solve technical challenges.
Use your knowledge in motor control theory for brushless motors and practical experience in evaluating those controls on dynamometers.
• Use your knowledge and experience with common debugging tools such as oscilloscope, network analyzer, CAN interface tools, emulators, to help troubleshoot and verify new designs.
Solve problems: You will use your ability to gather appropriate, often complex, data and diagnose the cause of a problem before taking action; separate causes from symptoms; apply lessons learned from others who encountered similar problems or challenges; anticipate problems and develop contingency plans to deal with them; develop and evaluate alternative courses of action.
Education and skills needed to succeed:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, or Computer Engineering.
Must have familiarity with embedded systems and experience developing the related hardware and/or software as well as a keen interest in learning.
A commitment to following The JTEKT Way values:
Customer first
Ownership
Teamwork and self-discipline
Continuous Kaizen
Aspiration for innovation and technique

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Our Client is looking for a Senior Software Engineer that has been around the block and has built great Software! The ideal candidate will be a key part of the new platform that is SAAS used for major clients globally. They are open to consider different profiles of the candidates complementary to the existing group.
Be part of a winning global team, where you will thrive in a culture that values collaboration and openness. They offer a fast-paced environment, and the opportunity to contribute significantly and put your fingerprint on the development and direction of our platform. As part of an international company you will experience the intimacy of a well-built virtual team while having the opportunity to collaborate with individuals from across Canada, the US and Europe.
Requirements
Position Overview
Manage multiple concurrent projects and overall development processes including planning, technical design, implementation, testing and shipping of scalable features.
Write and review code and provide technical direction to the group in all phases of development
Evaluate new technologies and stay current with a broad range of industry trends and developments.
Champion and implement best practices associated with technical architectures, capacity planning, developer tools, automation, and overall development processes.
Partner with Product Management, Hardware Engineering and Operations teams to create and implement processes and solutions that can scale
Help with hire, train, and develop talent.
Skill Requirements
BS or MS in Computer Science or Engineering
Minimum of 5 years of software development experience
Demonstrated understanding of quality assurance in the development of a great product.
Experience in the development of SaaS and cloud-based applications
Ability to learn new software languages, frameworks, and APIs quickly
Core competencies required:
Be a lead and coach to less experienced members of the group.
Able to architect new data required for new micro services or additional features.
Able to drive architecture compatible with the rest of the platform, or take platform in the new direction.
Able to architect new micro-services.
Hands on coding aspect is still very important.
Benefits

Title: Software Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About Paytm Labs:
At Paytm Labs, we’re on a mission to provide useful technological solutions that enrich and empower millions of people in their daily lives. We apply big data, artificial intelligence and machine learning to bring the next generation of financial products and services to the Indian, Japanese and Canadian markets.
As a company, we’re committed to offering the most transparent, secure, and personalized consumer experience to over 333 million consumers and over 21 million merchants. Since our journey began 6 years ago, we’ve launched the Paytm Canada app (our bill management app), and PayPay (a QR-based payment app in Japan), all while powering the Paytm India app.
Job Description:
Paytm Labs is looking for a Software Engineer to work on our global payments system which needs high scalability, reliability and availability. These challenges require lots of creative thinking based upon a very deep understanding of how software works.
Our ideal candidate is an ace problem solver and a learner at heart. You should have a very high degree of comfort in a programming language of your choice. We offer a flexible work schedule and you get your choice of tools (both hardware and software) and most importantly, the opportunity to work on tough problems with the brightest minds around you.
Responsibilities:
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Build back-end systems supporting payments, fraud prevention, advertisement, etc.
Understand concurrency, distributed computing, messaging and algorithm, and know the trade-offs between frequent delivery and technologies
Develop tools and contribute to open source wherever possible
Adopt problem solving as a way of life – always go to root cause!
Qualifications:
Strong fundamentals in data structure, algorithm and object oriented programming
Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages
Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed
Degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science or 3+ years equivalent experience in SaaS platform development
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, Scala or Go.
Implement platform components such as RESTful APIs, Pub/Sub Systems, Database Clients
NoSQL experience
Experience with AWS services
Contribute to open source projects
Why Join Paytm Labs!
Flexibility to WFH
For the third year in a row, we are proud to announce that we have been certified as a Great Place to Work
We were also certified as one of the Best Workplaces for Mental Wellness in 2020
We are an open work environment that fosters collaboration, ownership, creativity, and urgency
We ensure flexible hours outside of our core working hours
Enrolment in the Group Health Benefits plan right from day 1, no waiting period
Team building events
Fuel for the day: Weekly delivery of groceries, and all types of snacks
Catered lunches and desserts on a monthly basis
Daily fun in the office with our competitive games of Ping Pong, Pool, Smash Bros competitions, or FIFA
And of course, an unlimited amount of freshly made coffee and tea! We’re pretty serious about our coffee beans
Online learning through the platform, UDEMY
Notice for Job Applicants
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and uniqueness at our company. We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Paytm Labs is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.
Don't have Paytm Canada App yet?
Check us out in the Google Play or App Store.

Paytm Labs is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

Title: Intermediate Software Engineer - Richmond, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
About MDA
For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.
Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.
We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.
Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!
The Role
We’re on the hunt for a
Intermediate Software Engineer
on our Geointelligence team.
Our mission is to turn data into insight. From detecting changes in fragile ecosystems to monitoring northern ice floes and shipping routes, our near-real time data of Earth observation and the environment makes our Geointelligence team a leader in geospatial imagery, ground stations, enterprise geospatial systems and defence programs.
As our Software Development Engineer, you will contribute as part of a team to the design, implementation, maintenance, and testing of software solutions that are modular, extendable, testable, and efficient.
Responsibilities:
Creating engineering solutions that are technically competitive, cost-effective and have a direct impact on our customers
Working from requirements to develop or modify complex hardware/software systems
Planning work, providing effort estimates, driving your work to completion – on time & on budget
Designing, coding, testing, debugging and documenting high-quality software components
Working with the team to complete the integration, testing and deployment of the software components into the full system
Assisting in troubleshooting problems at both the software and the system level
Following established development processes and corporate technical and quality standards
Contribute to the continual improvement of our development processes.
Requirements:
A University Degree in computer science, software engineering, or a combination of related education and experience.
Proficient in at least one of Golang, Java, or C++.
An understanding of modern software architectures, object oriented design, and software design patterns.
Ability to quickly learn on the job and leverage your experiences and knowledge.
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication.
Team oriented approach.
Desirable:
Experience with Agile software development
Experience with test automation tools and libraries
Experience with Docker and service orchestration frameworks like Kubernetes and Rancher
Experience with Angular, React, or Vue frameworks
Experience with MATLAB and Simulink
Comments/Special Considerations:
Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.
MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.
MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.
With a priority on maintaining the safety of our employees, customers and communities, MDA has implemented a mandatory vaccination policy for employees and visitors. Please speak to a recruiter for more details.

Title: Network Engineer (Design Specialist II) - Core Network Engineering - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Location:
Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Calgary, AB, CA Toronto, ON, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Quebec City, Quebec, CA Montreal, Quebec, CA
Req ID: 11041
Jobs by Category: Technology Solutions
Job Function: Technology
Status: Full Time
Schedule: Regular
Join our team
Core Network Engineering (CNE) is on the forefront of the evolution of telecommunications technologies.
The CNE team is responsible for the deployment of TELUS Core Network infrastructure nationally including 5G and new wirelines solutions for our customers. The team is currently going through transformation to support new networking technologies such as software-defined networking (SDN), network functions virtualization (NFV) & Automation.
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
You are passionate about development and technology. Your creativity and innovative thinking knows no boundaries. Here is the opportunity to make your mark on a strong and established team going through a disruptive technology change. Contribute to our vision of the future by supporting it with your passion for technology and your will to simplify the user experience. With your strong attention to details, you will be consistently pushing yourself to build reliable next generation network infrastructure. This is the opportunity to gain knowledge and experience in the telecommunications industry by participating in the organization's digital transformation.
Here's How:
Working with a national team of highly skilled Network Engineers and DevOps Engineers to:
Logical configure IP Core Network Devices, including: Juniper, Nokia, and Cisco routers/switches
Complete logical migrations, capacity augmentation and operating system upgrades on IP Core Network devices
Develop fully automated network deployments leveraging CNE's CICD Pipeline and TELUS's Automation Framework
Leverage your Dev-Ops skills to help strengthen Dev-Ops practice within CNE and TELUS
You are the missing piece to the puzzle
Creative thinker and result driven
Hands on experience of IP Core protocols used in Service Provider networks: OSPF, BGP, MPLS, ISIS, STP
Knowledge/ Experience with the following hardware:
JUNIPER: EX, MX, QFX series
NOKIA: 7950, 7750, 7450 series
CISCO: ASR9k, NCS 5500, ME3400 series
2 to 5+ of years of experience as a Network Engineer, preferably in a DevOps environment
CCNP Certification or equivalent
Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
Great-to-haves
Ability to program in Python and understanding of data models such as YANG / JSON / YAML
Knowledge or experience with version control systems: Git / Gitlab / Github
Understanding of Next Generation Service Provider networks including SDN & NFV
A bit about us
Our business is connecting Canadians. Our social impact is using our world-leading technology to create meaningful change, give back to help communities thrive, and help those who need it most. When you join our team, you’re helping us make the future friendly. We’re committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability —your unique contributions and talents will be valued and respected here.

Title: Field Application Engineer - EMEA - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Come work with us!
Global manufacturers rely on Pleora’s real-time sensor interface products, standards knowledge, and systems’ expertise in mission-critical applications for the industrial automation, medical, and security and defense markets. Our solutions help system and device manufacturers bring new offerings to market quickly, while reducing risk and lowering costs.
Summary
To help support Pleora’s business growth in Europe we are searching for a dynamic Field Applications Engineer to be based in Western Europe. This individual will have capacity to build, test, and deploy AI models based on the Pleora AI implementation platform, and provide technical engineering support during pre-and-post sales phases, through engagement with camera and image device designers, system integrators, end-users, and distributors, as well as our internal sales & marketing, product management and engineering.
Solving complex problems on a daily basis, you will work with the sales team to target key and emerging accounts for Pleora’s growth opportunities in Europe to broaden the opportunity for our products and professional services as we expand into new sensor networking, IoT, machine vision, machine learning, AI, and embedded markets. You have the capacity to suggest new technologies and provide different design approaches that make for top-selling products. You will be provided the opportunity to travel, work with engineers on leading-edge designs, and close design and product contracts. Other duties may be assigned as required.
What you do
Be the point of contact with customers integrating Pleora solutions within their systems
Provide technical explanations to potential customers, with the ability to communicate unique technical selling points for products as part of our pre-sales activities
Provide technical solutions and communications to customers when support is requested as part of post-sales initiatives
Develop demo applications based on Pleora’s AI solutions and the eBUS SDK platform
Conduct technical onboarding and training sessions for new customers and design wins
Isolate, reproduce, and resolve customer technical support issues
Investigate system-level interactions between Pleora products and customer environments (PC, hardware, OS, LAN, cameras, etc.)
Create and maintain knowledge base articles and application notes, review technical publications
Coordinate feedback from pre-released product field trials and perform product validation to ensure specific customer requirements are met
Internally disseminate technical feedback on products, such as feature requests, competitive information and details on technical support issues
Ability to travel within the EMEA region – approximately a 25% basis – including quarterly visits to Pleora Headquarters in Ottawa, Canada
What you need
Seven+ years of related experience
Degree in Computer Science, Systems or Electrical Engineering, or related field; or a combination of education and related industry experience
Fluency in English, both written and verbal communication
Experience in working with North American and European based companies
Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills
Expert troubleshooting and root cause analysis skills
Ability to establish potential alternate solutions and various test setups
Ability to take initiative and drive for results
Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions
Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential customer relationships
Ability to work effectively in an interrupt-driven, fast-paced environment, using tact and diplomacy when dealing with global customers
Strong written and verbal communication skills; ability to explain complex system behaviours to those not intimately familiar with the product
Ability to draw out the key issues from customers, distil the details into focused summaries and communicate information to the appropriate individual
Ability to work and make technical decisions independently
Be an expert in some of the following
Application level experience, particularly image processing hardware and software solutions
Working with solutions in the IoT, industrial/machine vision, medical imaging and military imaging industries
Software development – C, C++, scripting languages (Python), in Windows and/or Linux
Low-level configuration of PC system internals including drivers
Embedded software/firmware (FPGA, DSP, etc.)
Hardware development
Setting up and troubleshooting small IP networks
Understanding and application of network standards, i.e. IEEE 802.3, RFC 768, etc.
Video processing, streaming and/or compression technologies
Why work at Pleora?
We trust our team – you bring the expertise and drive, we give you the freedom to explore and innovate
Excellent work-life balance – and we mean it!
We offer a diverse and inclusive workplace, in a fast-paced environment without “red tape” – giving you the opportunity to contribute your ideas and make a real contribution to our success.
Apply now to this great opportunity!
Please forward your resume in a PDF attachment to the attention of Human Resources
via
BambooHR
. We’ll review your application and have HR connect with you if you’re a good fit! We sincerely thank you for your interest. Pleora will provide reasonable accommodation to persons with disabilities to allow you to participate in the recruitment process, upon request.

Title: IT Support Specialist - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Purpose:
Reporting to the Manager of IT Infrastructure and Operations, the IT Support Specialist role provides technology support role for the Lassonde School of Engineering. Responsibilities include front-end helpdesk technical and end-user support for a variety of academic and administrative software, services, and related hardware. The role will also be responsible for installing, maintaining, and upgrading hardware and software in the Lassonde Computer Labs, and first-line Audio Visual and Educational Technologies support in the classrooms.
Education:
College diploma in Technology, Sciences or Computer Science field or an equivalent of 2 years recent experience (defined as within the last three years) working at York University and performing the same or similar tasks. This education equivalency is in addition to the experiential requirements outlined below. Certification in Microsoft Technologies such as MCSE, SharePoint and ITIL is considered an asset.
Experience:
Three (3) years of recent experience (defined as within the last 5 years) in end-user technical support and customer service including significant experience in the following: Microsoft Active Directory environment, SharePoint, Windows, MS SCCM, MS Development Tools. Office 365, Apple OS, Linux OS, Service Desk software, and asset management.
Skills:
Excellent analytical skills to diagnose and resolve software and hardware problems in a networked computing environment. Excellent customer service, written and oral communication skills to elicit accurate information from clients and be able to answer inquiries in an informative and tactful manner. Supporting others in the use of hardware and software systems. Ability to establish cooperative and effective working relationships. Ability to multi-task within an environment of frequent interruptions. Ability to show initiative. Ability to keep up to date with computer system developments. Good organizational skills.
Ability to maintain confidentiality & security of sensitive material.Other: Must have demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks while under pressure and be able to work both independently as well as an effective team member. Must have a willingness to learn, keep abreast of and master new technologies. Exercising tact and diplomacy. Dealing calmly and effectively with people. Attending accurately to details. Setting priorities and working effectively under pressure of high volume.Must be flexible with work hours for projects that will run in the evening or weekend to prevent disruption of classes or labs.Technical Skills required:SKILLS MATRIX: The following certifications are desired. Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist (MCTS). Microsoft Certified System Engineer (MCSE). Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP). ITIL V3 Foundations certification Specific technologies include but are not limited to: End User Technologies: Expert Level requiredo Desktop/Laptop/Tablet/Smart Phones technologies, MS Office 365 Client / Cloud version and similar productivity tools, disk/data encryption/compression tools, web conferencing systems, print technologies, wireless networking protocols, web-based technologies, computing devices configuration tools and image distribution technologies, multi-vendor systems, audio/video projectors, classroom technologies, lecture capture systems, consumer grade technologies. Enterprise Network Infrastructure level systems: Intermediate Level Requiredo Network Infrastructure technologies including switches, routers, security firewalls and intrusion detection, system monitoring tools, remote access / VPN systems, network cabling, data centre technologies. Backup and recovery systems including cloud/disk/tape/san/network replication technologies. Enterprise server technologies including Blade systems, SAN/NAS, Virtualization and clustering technologies. Operating Systems, Network and Communication Systems: Intermediate Level Require do MS Windows operating systems 20xx, SharePoint, Active Directory environment, Unix/Linux operating systems, Apple iOS Mac/Mobile, Android, TCP/IP and other network routing protocols, WiFi, Bluetooth, consumer grade technologies, print/scan/copier systems, virtualization technologies, LAN/WAN/SAN, VoIP, H323, A/V systems and web communication technologies. Desktop imaging, deployment and recovery technologies. Middleware/Application/Database Systems: Basic Level Requiredo Microsoft SQL/.NET/CRM tools, MySQL database, Oracle database, Student Information Systems, Salesforce. Web Content Management tools like WordPress, Drupal, Joomla, and other systems, Apache HTTP, SSL, and other web server technologies. Security Management Systems: Intermediate Level Requiredo Enterprise Anti-Virus, antispam, anti-phishing and other end client protection technologies. System logs, data security auditing tools, social engineering, network intrusion detection systems, firewall and other security technologies,
Additional Notes:
This position requires the candidate to produce a verification of degree(s), credentials(s), or equivalencies from accredited institutions and/or international equivalents at the time of interview.
In order to be considered as an internal applicant, York University employees in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit
must
apply for jobs through the
Employee Career Portal - YU Hire.
If you are a current York University employee in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit and/or are using your job posting rights under the collective agreement to apply for jobs, you MUST log into
YU Hire
to access the York University Employee Career Portal.
As per Article 12.02(f) of the YUSA-1 Collective Agreement, to be considered an internal applicant, employees in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit
must submit the application 5 working days following the first day of posting
. this is referred to as the
'Posted Date'
on the job the posting. This applies to YUSA-1 internal and YUSA-1 Concurrent postings. Please refer to the
'Posting Intent'
on the job posting.
If not filled by an employee in the YUSA-1 bargaining unit, employees in the YUSA-2 bargaining unit who have applied within the first 5 days from the
'Posted Date'
will be given preference.
NOTE: York University requires all community members, including employees and visitors who attend our campuses be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to medical and human rights exemptions, in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations. The University's
vaccine policy
is integral to our ongoing commitment to health and safety. Offers of employment require that you comply with the COVID-19 Vaccination Mandate by providing proof of vaccination prior to your start date. For information on how York University is responding to COVID-19 please visit the
YU Better Together
website.

Title: Product Development Engineer - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
TOA Corporation was founded in Kobe, Japan in 1934 and is the leading commercial audio, professional sound, and security product manufacturer in the world.
TOA products range from digital amplifiers and speakers, to mixers, wireless microphone systems and digital processors used in sound reinforcement, to integrated VOIP intercom and emergency paging and voice evacuation systems for security and communications.
Summary:
The position of “Product Development Engineer” is part of the Product Development Group at TOA Canada Corporation. The potential candidate must be able to perform all of the functions of the position. The Product Development Engineer is directly responsible in the support of the Product Development Manager to develop and enhance new and existing products, the preparation corresponding written documentation on these products and perform technical products testing as required.
The focus of this position will be primarily audio/intercom products, but the incumbent must have a working knowledge of IP technology and security as well.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
The Product Development Engineer candidate will spend a portion of their time (70-80%) to support the Product Development Manager to launch new products and upgrade existing products. They will monitor market trends and needs/demands from the market, sales staff and relative persons. The level of sophistication of the products involved requires the position to have an excellent understanding of TOA product hardware and software.
The Product Development Engineer will spend the other portion of their time (20-30%) receiving and placing phone calls, as a result of requests for information or assistance with TOA products. In this sense, the position is similar to the Product Support Specialist position, the difference being the level of experience and product knowledge required. The incumbent will help determine the cause of problems and failures, with precise on-the-phone troubleshooting. Email and Remote Desktop support are other commonly used method of support for TOA Canada. The candidate will understand proper email etiquette, as well as be fluent in proper remote desktop behavior.
The level of sophistication of the products involved requires the incumbent to have a fundamental understanding of the related concepts. With TOA having a vast product line up, being able to retain information over a variety of items is an asset. The candidate must be able to work independently on small projects and provide assistance to the Product Support Specialist on more complex projects. Duties will include support for sales and marketing.
The potential candidate will be required to fill in for the Product Support Specialist when the need arises.
The Product Development Engineer candidate will participate in meetings with counterparts from Japan, United States and elsewhere in product development and problem resolution. The measure of success in this position is based upon how well the individual works with others in the company. A large part of TOA’s competitive advantage lies with its success in Product Development Group.
Additionally, the Product Development Engineer candidate will participate in tradeshows in Canada the USA and elsewhere including before, during and after-show booth activities.
The duties and responsibilities listed herein are not all inclusive and the position and its responsibilities may change over time as business necessitates.
Qualification Requirements:
To perform this job successfully, you must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed herein are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.
Education and/or Experience:
A computer engineering degree or equivalent is required, along with 3-5 years’ experience in Audiovisual (AV) industry. Experience with SIP protocol and SIP products is considered an asset.
Language Skills:
The candidate will have proven verbal and written communication skills and must be able to express themselves clearly and decisively. The candidate should also possess the ability to explain complex concepts in a simple language. Bilingual is considered as an asset but not required.
Mathematical Skills:
The Candidate should be able to understand and explain mathematical concepts as they relate to the proper installation and operation of sound and communications equipment. In addition, the ability to understand engineering concepts is required.
Reasoning Ability:
The candidate should be able to perform abstract reasoning and be able to provide consistent explanations for complex problems. The candidate will also have responsibilities to prepare and conduct training sessions and to display a leadership role in technical settings.
Project Analysis Skills:
The Candidate should be able to understand and explain concepts as they relate to the proper installation and operation of sound and communications equipment. In addition, the ability to understand engineering concepts, AutoCAD drawings and tender submittals is required.
Time Management:
Many duties of the position will be presented in a list format. The candidate would understand the importance of time management and workload delegation. It is the responsibility of the candidate to be proactive with the multiple tasks assigned to them and see them through completion.
Physical Demands:
The physical demand of the position is not overly challenging. On a day-to-day basis, the incumbent may be required to hook up and test product configurations in our lab. Some carrying and lifting would be necessary. The incumbent may also be required to assist in trade shows and other events, which may require frequent lifting over a period of days. The incumbent may be involved in field troubleshooting and may be required to travel alone to and work on job sites, functioning as a professional representing TOA in a positive manner.
Work Environment:
Traveling is not a regular part of the job. The work environment is a professional office, with travel to trade shows in the US and elsewhere. At this time, it is estimated that the candidate will travel on business 15-20% of the time.
TASKS
Product Development
· Test new and existing products and services, and report to the manager with an evaluation report.
· Carry out market research with sales staff and our key customers to get market information or needs frequently.
· Prepare documentation on newly launched products or services.
· Participate in annual trainings to develop new skills or improve their skills.
Return Authorizations (RA)
· Issue RA forms based on dealer requests.
· Determine the return is in accordance with published terms.
· Maintain a Database of RA requests.
· Manage B-Stock inventory
· Inspect returned items.
· Finalize disposition of returned product.
Service Depots
· Technical support
· Parts request
· Product support and supply for repairs
Product Modifications
· Evaluate
· Document
· Delegate modification
CSA Inspections
· Determine product modifications if any required to meet CSA special inspection
· Document
· Implement
Warranty
· Approve repair invoicing from Service Depots
· Maintain database of warranty repairs
Showroom
· Set up and maintain showroom and make ready for customer demonstrations and RSM use.
Service area (shop)
· Organize and maintain returns and equipment in service area
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $50,000.00-$80,000.00 per year
Additional pay:
Bonus pay
Benefits:
Extended health care
Paid time off
RRSP match
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
No weekends
COVID-19 considerations:
All employees are required to wear a mask in the office.
Application question(s):
Do you have experience with SIP and SIP enabled devices?
Do you have experience with DANTE products?
Experience:
audio visual: 3 years (preferred)
Work remotely:
No

Title: Senior Software Engineer – Hair and Cloth Toolset - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Summary:
At Walt Disney Animation Studios we have a deep commitment to the philosophy that creativity inspires technology, and technology inspires creativity. Engineers in our Production Technology department are charged with developing and implementing new algorithms to solve challenging problems for all of our animated content. We do this working alongside a user base that shares a collaborative environment with us, and uses the code we develop daily.
We are looking for an engineer to join our Production Technology team, targeting development of our in-house Hair and Cloth toolset. Our developers work in a collaborative environment in the pursuit of simple and performant solutions to complex problems. In this role, you will be part of a small dedicated team of cross-site developers who partner closely with the Character TD and Look artists using the tools, as well as production and technology leadership, technical directors, cross-team software engineers, and researchers.
The developer filling this role would use a variety of techniques including simulation algorithms, applied research, high performance parallel computation, geometric and procedural techniques, efficient data parsing and storage, and other computer graphics algorithms with associated artist workflows. In-depth understanding of both underlying mathematical and theoretical foundations as well as user-facing workflow needs are qualities we seek in an ideal candidate.This is a regular, full time, staff position that will be located at our Vancouver, BC studio. Please note that relocation eligibility may be determined based on role and individual circumstance.
Responsibilities:
Projects Include
Evolve, expand, and support our custom tool suite for grooming, tailoring, cloth/hair simulation, and additional in-shot work (e.g. sculpting, character performance tuning)
Develop new approaches for art-directed simulation with a high level of artistic control
Expand our procedural geometry tools for creating hair styles and fur grooms,
Collaborate with artists on developing intuitive visualizations and interactive workflows
What does it mean to be a developer here at WDAS?
Our engineers get the opportunity to work on the full stack of our tools, from developing the underlying algorithms through building intuitive artist-friendly interfaces.
Work hand in hand with artists to make the tools we need for the incredibly complex and rich characters and environments featured in our movies.
Support the artists in their day-to-day work including debugging any issues with the tools as well as brainstorming on the best use of the tools to solve a particular creative challenge.
Develop new artist-centric interaction models using the latest hardware and technologies.
Basic Qualifications:
Professional experience in a software developer role
Master’s/Ph.D. with specialization in Computer Graphics (with a focus on areas related to our hair and cloth toolset) or comparable industry experience in a research, studio, or games environment
Proficiency in C++, strong software design and engineering skills
Strong mathematical fundamentals, such as linear algebra and numerical methods
Excellent problem solving, troubleshooting and debugging skills
Ability to develop and optimize algorithms for efficiency and scalability
Deep understanding of computer graphics foundational concepts, algorithms, and related artistic workflows
Ability to prioritize competing demands
Exemplary communication, including the ability to engage with artists to understand their requirements and formulate practical solutions
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working in an Animation production environment
Expertise in performance tuning and writing/debugging of parallel and vectorized code
Knowledge of the latest publications in the academic community relevant to hair and cloth
Familiarity with UI development toolkits (QT) for building clean interfaces
Ability to adapt and extend relevant research to production-level tools tailored to the specific art-directed needs
Working knowledge of Python
Other expertise: Maya, Houdini, USD, OpenGL

Title: Software Engineering Inter - Ontario - Indeed.com
Description:
Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect.
Analog Devices Inc.
(ADI) is a leading manufacturer of precision high performance integrated circuits used in analog and digital signal processing. In over 40 years, Analog Devices has earned a reputation for leadership in the semiconductor industry through technological innovation, impressive growth and strong earnings. Analog Devices offers a wide variety of industry-leading products in analog, mixed-signal and digital signal processing; and stands alone as the clear leader in the field.
The Analog Devices Toronto Design Center is an innovative, highly focused and dynamic organization with a leadership role in the end-to-end systems solutions for high-definition digital media, portable/mobile platforms, and advanced analog to digital conversion (ADC). Our technology teams are developing the high-speed data converters (ADCs, DACs and Transcievers) based on the latest technologies, next generation of products in the areas of High Definition Video and Audio including the next generation HDMI, Video Signal Processors and their associated Embedded Systems, and.
If you join Analog Devices, you will be working side-by-side with the top talent in the industry and technology leaders whose accomplishments are well known and who have fostered the growth and development of analog circuit design and signal processing technology. The diversity of technology, products, and challenges you will find at ADI, as well as the opportunity to be mentored by our top contributors, will provide you with the knowledge and freedom to innovate and explore as your skills grow.
Job Description
We are currently seeking to hire engineering students who enjoy collaborating within talented and energetic embedded software development and test groups. In this position, you will be involved with the design, development, and test of embedded systems targeted for data converters. We need highly motivated and creative hardware/software engineers from electrical and computer engineering backgrounds with very strong knowledge and experience in some or all of the following areas.
The incumbent will be given a project to design, implement and test a significant portion of an embedded system on the FPGA. The purpose of the program is to help customers test the data converters in total system chain. The candidate will also be responsible to create or improve the test automation procedures as required. Through this process, he/she will develop and enhance his/her knowledge of communication systems, and gain valuable experience by involving in the real world production cycle.
Responsibilities
Develop embedded software for embedded systems using C/C++.
Develop SW on PC using C# .Net
Design, develop, and execute system level testing, strategies, test plans
Constantly improve comprehensiveness, quality, and scope for software releases.
Increase efficiency through automation and application of appropriate test technology, tools, and innovation.
Provide well documented hardware and software modules and collaborate with other team members in producing an organized development structure
Utilize source control techniques and maintain software development and release processes
Job Requirements
Experience with C/C++ programming language.
Knowledge/Experience with scripting languages (e.g.: Pythons, etc.)
Experience with C# .Net
Well versed with Microsoft Windows computer systems, networks and applications
Produce professional engineering reports, diagrams and manuals
Asset
Experience with FPGA (Xilinx, ALTERA).
Experience with embedded systems hardware and software design and applications
Experience as Test/QA engineer and/or software developer
Knowledge of signal processing and communication systems.
Experience with labView and Matlab.

Title: Electrical Research Engineer, Mount Pearl, NL Office - Mount Pearl, NL - Indeed.com
Description:
Developing wireless power technology isn’t your everyday office job!
As a close team of under twenty people, everyone at Solace Power Inc. contributes to pushing the limits and redefining the
way we think about wireless power. We are currently looking for a new team member who can help us research, develop,
and test technology that truly doesn’t exist anywhere else!
We mean it when we say that Solace isn’t your average job. From implementing wireless power technology in a car door to
developing our latest patentable concept – no two days are ever the same.
We are looking for an Electrical Research Engineer with a focus on software/hardware to join our Engineering Research and
Development Team. Our goal is to find a teammate with an in-depth understanding of analogue/digital electronic design
methods/techniques, and real-time software development. This individual will also be fully engaged in all stages of our
development lifecycle.
A Typical Day at Solace
Work with Engineering Management and the R&D team to ensure our designs make the market love us!
Create hardware/software systems and design specifications.
Ensure our applications meet design requirements.
Perform analog design simulations, test-bench creation, and design verification.

Title: Software Defined Radio Embedded Engineer - Canada - Indeed.com
Description:
Location:
Austin, TX, Canada and US, Remote
Coherent Logix Incorporated is the world leader of the lowest power, high performance, C-programmable processors for the embedded systems market. Our comprehensive solutions portfolio includes processors, integrated system development tools, optimized libraries, system reference designs, and a customizable system development platform to reduce development complexity and time-to-market. These solutions are designed to support a wide variety of industries, including automotive, broadcast, computer, consumer, industrial, medical, military, test and measurement, wireless, and wireline. Further information is available at www.coherentlogix.com.
Description
This position will be responsible for algorithm implementation in a reconfigurable and adaptable signal processing platform targeting communication system solutions that demand real-time, high performance, ultra-low power, computation intensive hardware and software for various broadcast/broadband software defined radio engagements.
The person will be responsible for developing real-time solutions in a Software Defined Radio development environment for the commercial and military market spaces. Requires an in-depth understanding of wireless communications, DSP algorithm development and efficient real-time system implementation.
Design requirements span:
Embedded programming in high performance parallel processing
Ability to understand core math / algorithms and architect for parallel implementation
Optimize algorithm implementation for high throughput and efficiency
Signal detection/acquisition
Digital Up/Down Conversion, Channelization
Channel estimation and compensation
Offset estimation, tracking and compensation
Signal modulation and demodulation
Single/multi-carrier,
Spread spectrum, CPM
SISO/(Massive) MIMO
Qualifications
C/C++ on embedded processors
Consider Verilog or similar FPGA programming experience
DSP Assembly Language
MATLAB/Simulink programming
Ability to work independently, meet project deadlines fully documenting work
Must have good written and verbal communication skills
Education & Experience
MS/BS in EE or CS
Hands-on experience with real-time system development
In-depth knowledge of one or more of the following communication standards:
3GPP 4G/5G Wireless Communications
Terrestrial Television Broadcast
Satellite Communications
Position is open to U.S. Citizens, Greencard holders, or other existing visa holders eligible to work in the U.S.

Experience working within an Entertainment/Media industry is desirable

Title: Systems Engineer - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
We are currently seeing an experienced System Administrator to join our team. The System Administrator must
have a deep and broad knowledge of computer software, hardware and networks and will be responsible for
designing, organizing, modifying, and supporting our company’s computer systems.
The System Administrator will operate in a hybrid virtualization environment that includes supporting virtualized
servers in both on-prem and in cloud, multiple docker container environments, storage management, and server
management.
The core mission of this role will be focused on improving an established change management process and growing our use of Ansible as an orchestration tool.
Daily tasks may include (but not limited to) installing, upgrading, and monitoring software and hardware, maintaining the essentials such as operating systems, business applications, databases, security tools, web-servers, email, laptop, and desktop PCs, and collaborating with other operations teams outside of the IT department that are conducting similar work.
Job Responsibilities:
Work with other functional teams to compare/contrast technologies and help unify technologies to meetcorporate objectives.
Ensure design of system allows all components to work properly together
Make recommendations for future upgrades
Monitor and maintain system security
Troubleshoot problems reported by users and analyze and isolate issues
Evaluate and modify system’s performance
Assign configuration of authentication and authorization of directory services
Deliver on commitments IT has promised to the business
Administer servers, laptop and desktop computers, printers, routers, switches, firewalls, phones, company mobile phones, smartphones, software deployment, security updates and patches
Back office Linux Admin tasks, Xenserver and database admin tasks
Qualifications Required:
Bachelor degree in either Computer Sciences, Information Systems, or Computer/Electrical Engineering.
At least 5+ years experience with Linux System Administration. 8+years if no degree.
Specific experience with System Administration and understanding of:
Debian (Ubuntu) Linux
Redhat Enterprise (Centos) Linux
General experience with System Administration and understanding of Microsoft Windows Server 2008-2019
Specific experience with Ansible Orchestration Tool
Generic experience with Enterprise Backup tools
Specific experience with scripting (bash and python)
Specific experience with open-source database (MySQL and/or PostgreSQL) with Galera experience as as a plus
General experience with directory & authentication provider administration (LDAP / Active Directory /
SaML / IDP)
General experience with basic Internet and network troubleshooting.
Specific experience with multi-node hypervisor environments
General experience with VMWare
Any experience with Xen, KVM, OpenStack, Solas, or Proxmox is a plus
Experience with iSCSI SANS; Dell EQ knowledge is a plus
Experience with ITIL is a plus
Experience with Agile is a plus
Benefits:
Medical, Dental and Vision through GWL; RRSP/DPSP savings plan and 3 weeks vacation.
About Sangoma:
Founded in 1984, Sangoma Technologies (TSX VENTURE: STC) is a trusted leader in value-based Unified Communications (UC) and UC as a Service (UCaaS) solutions for SMBs, enterprises, OEMs, carriers, and service providers. Sangoma’s Voice over IP offerings include on-premise and cloud-based phone systems, SIP trunking services, and telephony hardware. Sangoma’s products and services are used in leading PBX, IVR, contact center, carrier networks, and data communication applications worldwide. Sangoma is the primary developer and sponsor of the Asterisk project, the world’s most widely used open source communications software, and FreePBX, the world’s most widely used open source PBX software. Businesses can achieve enhanced levels of collaboration, productivity, and ROI with Sangoma. Everything Connects, Connect with Sangoma! Additional information can be found at www.sangoma.com, www.asterisk.org, and www.freepbx.org

Description:
Req ID: 81047
Region: Americas
Country: Canada
State/Province: Ontario
City: Toronto
Summary of Description:
The Global Customer Business Unit (GCBU) Power Control Systems and Firmware Design Engineer oversees embedded design for customers across a variety of smart energy and power systems markets. This lead will work closely with customers to develop product specifications and then to provide guidance to the global design team in power, electronics and controls design. The Power Control Systems and Firmware Design Engineer will work alongside the Global Sales & Business Development team, mechanical designers, application engineers, and program management to develop and deliver products in accordance with the customer requirements.
This is a remote position.
Role
Responsibilities
This position reports to the Global Customer Business Unit (GCBU) Director of Engineering to perform the following responsibilities:
Lead firmware development for Celestica’s Industrial and Smart Energy design organization.
Create and manage product level and system level firmware specifications at a project and/or program level.
Manage product and system level firmware implementation by working with Celestica product design team members and partners.
Initiate designs of innovative, high efficiency, power conversion topologies and circuits at power levels in hundreds of watts with switching frequency up to the MHz range.
Participate in development of power conversion management systems and development of system solutions for easy system install, commissioning and maintenance.
Active participation in industry conferences and standardization bodies to influence and facilitate development of Celestica’s innovative, market leading product offering.
Participate in other power related technology initiatives.
Knowledge/Skills/Competencies
Deep knowledge Machine to Machine (M2M) communications standards
Strong knowledge of Human to Machine Interface (HMI) development fundamentals
Broad knowledge and understanding of Engineering design, test, quality, and production in a manufacturing environment.
Broad knowledge of microprocessor and microcontroller technologies and development environments.
Deep experience with C, C++, Go, Java, Python etc.
Knowledge of materials, supply chain, and components used in the manufacturing of electro-mechanical systems, printed circuit boards and subassemblies.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate with a wide variety of internal and external customers.
Excellent presentation and computer skills.
Ability to evaluate product performance metrics as well as diagnose and resolve technical issues
Other Areas of Consideration
The following areas of experience are preferred but not required:
Power electronics design
On-Vehicle communications standards
Understanding of automotive electrification products, standards, and certification requirements
Education and Experience
B.S. in Electrical Engineering (EE), plus 8+ years of experience, or MS in EE with 6+ years of experience
Experience in the design, development, and testing of electric machines
Working knowledge of vehicle electronics design, manufacturing, testing & certification standards
High level of interpersonal skills to work independently and effectively with domestic and international business partners
Strong understanding of system level design and integration
Ability to interface with clients with a positive, inquiring, and value-added approach
Creating and maintaining efficient and high-speed system functions for high-speed Ethernet communication networks.
Preparing specifications and documentation of designs.
Study custom requirements and evolving standards.
Implementation, optimization, simulation, and debugging of high-speed functions for ASIC and FPGA technologies.
Collaborate with system-level and design engineers during implementation and verification to meet time schedules.
Support and collaborate with other disciplines such as Firmware Engineers and Hardware Engineers.
Champion best practices and design craft in Verilog-based FPGA design development.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a Technical Discipline (Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science), or equivalent work-related experience, with 8+ years of hands-on practical and relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.

Experience with high-speed serial communications, high speed ethernet, and network interfaces and protocols.

Functional test of developed code.

Title: Embedded SW Engineer - Valcourt, QC - Indeed.com
Electronics Quality Engineer - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Description
Our mission is to democratize industrial automation for small and medium enterprises. We are a technology company that equips organizations to be agile and innovative, and for their people to be productive, creative, and happier at work. That means enabling our customers to automate their facilities, helping them build the workplace of tomorrow, and enabling them to make smarter decisions about their manufacturing portfolio. By doing these things, we create success faster and in circumstances otherwise not possible. It’s an enormous market and every day we are challenging customers to disrupt and innovate. It has never been a better, more rewarding time to be in industrial automation. With over 1800 customers, triple-digit growth over the last 12 months, and a world-class leadership team, Vention is an incredible opportunity.
Job Description
We are looking for a Quality Engineer to lead QA for our Automation Product Development team! Reporting directly to the Principal Engineer for Automation & Applications, is a critical role in our product development process. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests during product development and participate in go/no-go decision making at product launches, and eventually bring in automated testing. Working in a highly collaborative and agile environment, you will work closely with developers, product managers and business owners to guarantee the quality of any Automation products being developed, on all our cloud and edge platforms (Vention website, MachineMotion controller, Teach Pendant).
More specifically, you will:
Be responsible for the quality assurance of embedded software of automation products
Plan and prioritize testing requirements.
Design and build test cases, perform tests and analyze the result
Build and maintain test plans
Design, develop and execute automation scripts.
Have a hands-on approach to creating your physical test environment on Vention machines (installing motors, assembling mechanical actuators, building test jigs)
Have a hands-on approach to deploying your software test environment (shell commands, managing code in Git, Linux programming)
Arbitrate the flow of feature and bug resolutions during the "sprints"; catch issues before they're deployed; revalidate post deployment
Communicate issues, risks, and test status in a timely and detailed manner to all stakeholders.
Build processes and infrastructure to streamline QA activities, increase quality and increase test coverage. Among others, this may include continuous integration, automated test suites, design and build physical test jigs and automated software configuration management.
Qualifications
*
3+ years of experience in software quality assurance, working in a software development environment.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Experience in Software Testing for embedded systems, QA methodologies, testing processes and testing tools.
Strong skills at finding and isolating bugs; patient, and eager to improve systems incrementally; mindful of business priorities
Software programming experience: fluency with linux shells and the linux environment, with git, python, javascript, build processes & makefiles, debugging tools (gdb, pdb, nodejs debugger), awareness of communication protocols
Autonomy and resourcefulness in front of industrial automation hardware.
Good organizational skills, detail-oriented mindset and independant
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency with electronic circuits and monitoring tools is an asset
Additional Information
We stand proudly for our people and support their success through career development and advancement. We are recognized and respected for our culture of inclusion and belonging, continuously striving to do what’s good for our people and communities.
Location: 4767 Rue Dagenais, Montréal, QC
Job Type: Full-time

Job Description:
As a key member of the BLiNQ Design Team, you will work closely with RF, Mechanical and Antenna design engineers towards delivering cost-effective and leading-edge wireless product solutions. You will be part of the Hardware Design Team responsible for producing cost effective and highly functional products.
This position requires strong problem solving skills, self-motivation and strong inter-disciplinary teamwork skills. You must demonstrate the ability to work efficiently on multiple product development platforms and with tight project schedules. If you like to work in a fast paced environment with opportunities to learn and develop new skills which you won’t find anywhere else, please apply by sending a resume to .
Responsibilities:
Perform hardware product/module validation and verification
Review product/module designs and requirements, develop functional and system level test cases and test plans to validate or improve products/modules
Design and implement design test tools for validation and verification purposes (PC software/scripts, test jigs)
Prepare product/module production test processes, develop test plans/specifications and write test reports
Analyze early products/modules during prototype and NPI phases to identify any manufacturing defect and resolve all hardware issues in coordination with development engineers
Support FCC/ETSI pre-certification and final certification process
Support production product/module failures investigation
Prepare product/module level troubleshooting packages and documentation
Troubleshoot failed products/modules raised during development or early trials
Firmware feature validation at signal level
Requirements:
B.S. degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent discipline
3 or more years of industry experience in hardware testing
Must demonstrate hardware test expertise and experience in signaling integrity, electrical design verification, digital logic design testing and system level integration
Experience with hardware/system testing (design validation) process and Q/A
Knowledge of digital and analog circuit designs including micro-processors, power distribution, high speed signaling and clocking circuits
Knowledge of lower level component based manual testing and board probing
Deep knowledge of standard lab tools like oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzer, DC loads, JTAG tools
Networking experience (Ethernet, TCP/IP)
Strong verbal and written communication skills (English)
Must be able to understand and follow instructions and to communicate issues to their test leads
Must be able to create relevant reports, analyze the gathered data and write conclusions
Organized with a strong attention to detail
Strong Team spirit
About BLiNQ Networks
BLiNQ Networks is the wireless product design center for its parent company Communication Components Inc. Products (CCI Products).
Communication Components Inc. is one of the fastest growing providers of base station enhancement products. Our innovative products are designed to allow service providers to get the most out of their base station investments. Whether capacity expansion or coverage enhancement is the objective, CCI has the appropriate solution to meet the need. With thousands of field-proven solutions in deployment, in PCS, Cellular and SMR environments, CCI brings expertise, technology, and reliability. CCI's capacity expansion products will allow a basestation to grow radio count without adding feeders and antennas, and with no loss of coverage. CCI creates turn-key solution from design assistance to site commissioning.

Title: Intermediate System Engineer - Burnaby, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
About NETINT Technologies Inc.
NETINT Technologies is a pioneer of computational storage and video processing SoC solutions for cloud and edge computing. Its Codensity portfolio enables enterprise, cloud data centers, and content providers to deploy high-performance applications that they can scale without limit while minimizing their data storage and video processing costs. NETINT, founded by an experienced team of storage SoC veterans, is a Canadian venture-funded startup with R&D facilities in Vancouver, Toronto, and Shanghai, China. For more information, visit www.netint.ca.
Job Scope
As a System Engineer, you are responsible for the functionality and quality of the ASIC design at the system level. You are detail oriented in designing and executing stress tests, and good at systematically identifying and reproducing hardware and firmware issues. You will be working closely with ASIC designer and embedded FW engineer to develop solutions and workarounds. Responsibilities for this position include designing/ implementing/ executing stress tests at subsystem and system levels, functional modules, and all data flows of Storage and Video SoCs.
Responsibilities
Hands on debug capability using lab equipment and debugger tools
Bring up of embedded CPU/GPU cores, subsystem blocks and system level integration on prototype boards
Develop embedded firmware for system level stress tests
Develop automation test platform and test scripts
Work with hardware and firmware teams on identifying and resolving issues, and come up with workaround solutions
Work on prototyping platform development and verification of current and future SoCs
Qualifications
MS or BS in Electrical/Computer Engineering or equivalent
Minimum 2 years of experiences in system validation or ASIC/FPGA IP/VIP integration and design
Ability to understand hardware technical reference manual
Experience with embedded FW in C/C++ and assembly
Experience with CPU architectures, high speed I/Os and on-chip interconnects
Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python, TCL, Perl
Strong ability to analyze complex HW issues and find resolutions
Highly Desirable Skills
Experience of working on video products is an asset
Experience in PCB design, layout, and board bring up is an asset
Knowledge of silicon testing/qualification procedure/methodology for production is an asset
We thank you for your interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Acknowledgment and Agreement
NETINT Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, NETINT will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.

Embedded Linux and/or VxWorks

LI-CN

Title: TCMS System Engineer - Saint-Bruno-de-Montarville, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Req ID:
201278
We create smart innovations to meet the mobility challenges of today and tomorrow. We design and manufacture a complete range of transportation systems, from high-speed trains to electric buses and driverless trains, as well as infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a truly global community of more than 70000 people dedicated to solving real-world mobility challenges and achieving international projects with sustainable local impact.
Join us as TCMS System Engineer , and you’ll be looking at a career-defining role based in St-Bruno (QC), CA.
You will be responsible for delivering engineering solutions to agreed timescales, within budget & to an acceptable quality standard.
The role is to develop, validate and prepare modifications and maintenance changes to AME SER supported fleets that are in commercial service. The primary purpose of this position is to develop engineering solutions and engineering change documentation in support of in-service fleets, predominantly focused on Safety, Reliability, and System / Vehicle enhancements.
Primary work domains will be:
modifications to existing software systems, correction of bugs, new feature development, subsystems hardware and software integration. Manages the functional and technical interface between Vehicle Engineering and TCMS Engineering according to the vehicle engineering process and provides a single point of contact in expertise for all functional and technical topics of subsystem TCMS, working in the multidisciplinary project team.
You will have a demonstrable knowledge and capability across a range of vehicle systems and be responsible for providing technical leadership in the development of vehicle modifications, be familiar with relevant industry standards and have a proven capability in the developing and justifying technical solutions, producing vehicle modification documentation as required.
You will liaise with engineers/specialists ensuring compliance with appropriate Industry Standards. In addition you will liaise with other engineering functions to ensure a fully integrated, safe & compliant design. As part of the design process you will need to ensure the company’s commercial interests are not compromised. The role will also include providing technical support and solutions to the Production Line, Procurement, Quality, Suppliers & Test as required.
Candidate must be versatile, very autonomous, with hands-on experience, comfortable working in unclear and ill-defined environments, resourceful to find information. Candidate must be comfortable with working in legacy development environments with potentially obsolete tools.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provides technical leadership, ensuring adherence to engineering processes to provide high quality solutions that meet customer’s requirements. Reviews and influences the design solutions to ensure they are in accordance with all applicable requirements.
Carry out high integrity validation of vehicle modifications undertaken against industry standards. To identify, review and close out risks, to develop and participate in system test procedures or other validation approaches as appropriate.
Participates in design reviews internally and with customers.
Develop and manage Interface requirements. Lead design reviews, internal and with customer.
Maintain close contact with all stakeholders on status of work package. Responsibility for tracking their progress and adherence to budgeted hours through task planning. Develops action plans and coordinates resources to address and resolve problems as needed.
Technical lead for the whole design lifecycle (concept, prelim, detail and realization), Development of design concepts and BOMs as required.
Identify and recommend improvements where established technology components and methodologies are inadequate or where the implementations of solutions are not effective.
Optimizes communication and relationships with customers and other functions. Implementation of processes/tools/behaviors by taking into account business requirements, customer needs, technical innovations, and new market conditions.
Initiates cross functional reviews to communicate the design development of all interfaces and develop/plan design solutions and mitigations resulting from review actions.
Provides technical support to BT Bid Teams, developing technical solutions, Engineering costs and programs as required.
Estimates costs and schedules. Organizes and structures personal workload to achieve consistent on time delivery against the Engineering Plan
Provide immediate technical support to teams operating in the field
REQUIRED PROFILE:
Bachelors in Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science
Computer skills required:
Linux, VxWorks, C, C++, IEC1131, embedded systems, TCP/IP, UDP, Ethernet
Microsoft Office
Minimum 7 years of relevant work experience
Technical domain experience essential, Systems Integration experience required, System Architectural understanding required.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.
An agile, inclusive and responsible culture is the foundation of our company where diverse people are offered excellent opportunities to grow, learn and advance in their careers. We are committed to encouraging our employees to reach their full potential, while valuing and respecting them as individuals.
Alstom is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, National, or Local Laws.
Effective 29 January 2021, Alstom completed the acquisition of Bombardier Transportation. This is a Bombardier Transportation Legal Entity Position - positions at Bombardier Transportation companies are all members of the Alstom Group .
