Title: Senior ASIC Verification Engineer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description
An engineering position with Intel of Canada's Intel Optane Group is a challenging but rewarding experience, allowing you to gain knowledge and experience in design and test of IC and module products for the next generation of Solid State Drives (SSDs). As a member of our Controller Hardware Engineering team, you will work alongside experienced engineers to solve new and interesting problems, making an important contribution to our exciting high performance SSD projects.
Data is our future. 90 percent of all data today was created in the last two years and this trend will only accelerate. With the advent of AI, autonomous cars and data science, all of the data infrastructure we have built until now will need to be doubled in the next five years. Can you think of the possibilities?
The Vancouver ASIC team develops SoCs which power next generation Client and Enterprise Optane Solid State Drives (SSDs) and Memory products - a key enablers for our data hungry future. Modern ASICs have grown exponentially more complex in order to enable greater functionality, to push the limits of performance and to use less power. Nevertheless, ASIC verification must absorb and adapt to this growth because high quality ASICs are crucial for success. Our team develops object-oriented models using cutting edge techniques and methodologies which are then simulated and compared against the ASIC.
A Pre-Si verification engineer owns one or more architectural functional blocks to perform all verification related tasks:
Create test plan and develop test bench using UVM methodology.
Develop & advance UVM/Formal-based verification architectures and methodologies
Manage verification regression testing, including results triage and delegating debugging for failed tests
Mentor and coach members of the team
Perform IP and block level coverage driven verification.
Improve existing methodologies to enable effective verification.
Perform Formal Verification, Low Power Verification, Performance Verification, Co-Simulation, Emulation, etc.
We are looking for enthusiastic individual who is willing to do problem-solving, excellent communication and desire to learn. Technically, a solid foundation of digital design (System Verilog) and object-oriented programming is desired but not required. Individual who is looking for a challenging and rewarding work experience should not hesitate to apply
Employees are encouraged to work remotely due to Covid-19, all new hire orientations will be done virtually. This is subject to change and employees deemed as essential workers may be required to work on-site.
Qualifications
Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field.
Minimum Required Qualifications:
6+ years of experience in the following areas:
HDLs and HVL (e.g. SystemVerilog, OVM, UVM, etc.)
Debugging.
Project based teamwork.
Object Oriented Programming experience.
Additional Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree preferred.
Linux experience
Programming Languages: Python, Perl, C and C++, System C
Low Power Verification
Formal Verification
Familiarity with NVMe and PCIe is a highly desired
Working experience with IP/ASIC/SoC block level or top level verification
Inside this Business Group
Non-Volatile Solutions Memory Group: The Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group is a worldwide organization that delivers NAND flash memory products for use in Solid State Drives (SSDs), portable memory storage devices, digital camera memory cards, and other devices. The group is responsible for NVM technology design and development, complete Solid State Drive (SSD) system hardware and firmware development, as well as wafer and SSD manufacturing.
Intel is committed to a culture of accessibility. Intel provides accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Find information and request accommodation here

Title: C++ Software Developer (Vision & Robotics) - Waterloo, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About Voyis:
Voyis designs and manufactures high performance underwater optical sensors (lasers, cameras, lights) for autonomous underwater vehicles that expand capability and enhance understanding in underwater surveys and exploration. Our products have enabled our customers to survey more than 10,000km of ocean floor across all 7 continents, helping people better understand those remote, challenging environments. Our mission is to push the limits of what’s possible subsea and enable every subsea vehicle to see the depths like we see the surface.
Our underwater laser scanners, cameras and lights are proudly designed, engineered, and built in Waterloo, Canada. Voyis operates independently under ownership of Sonardyne Group.
What you’ll do:
As a Software Developer at Voyis you will be developing software for capturing and analysing data from subsea cameras, lasers, and navigation sensors. You will implement image correct and SLAM algorithms and other advanced computer vision tools developed by the R&D team.
We are looking for someone who is eager to learn and work collaboratively with our multidisciplinary engineering team to achieve industry leading results. We are a small team with loads of exciting opportunities where everyone is expected to take ownership and push boundaries in order to achieve our goals, together.
This position will work closely with our sister company EIVA, in Denmark. EIVA is a global leader in subsea data processing and workflow software with 40 software engineers.
Specific responsibilities include:
Developing in C/C++ Linux environment, you will implement stereocamera solutions and SLAM algorithms that use sensor data for underwater awareness and point cloud generation.
Along with a Senior Computer Vision developer - test and implement computer/machine vision algorithms to enable object detection, estimation of pose and position, navigation aiding, and loop closure - all in a challenging underwater environment
Create software tools for repeatable and robust calibration of complex multi-sensor packages using intrinsics and extrinsics
Support and collaborate with broader engineering team and our sister companies to produce reliable and complete product solutions
Write efficient and maintainable code and support others with reviews and test
Occasional field testing (local) and some international travel will be required
Skills you will bring to the table:
Highly proficient in C/C++ programming and debugging. Proven track of writing robust code.
2+ years experience knowledge and experience in full-stack robotics development including
Experience with OpenCV, CUDA, GPU programming
Expeirence with multi-sensor integrations (camera, lidar, INS, GPS, etc) and data processing
Technical degree in Software Development, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related
A positive attitude where you continuously strive for improvement and have the ability to succeed without all the answers
Proven ability to inspire, encourage, and collaborate with your team
Bonus Points for:
Experience working with hardware (embedded computers, cameras, cabling)
Experience with optical systems and image processing
Experience in or a passion for the underwater discovery and robotics
The Perks:
Flexible work hours, plenty of vacation, and a dedication to a well-rounded work-life balance
Generous employee-directed personal education funds to drive continuous learning
Profit-sharing to celebrate our successes together
Regular company-wide social events (even remotely!)
Health and vision benefits
Why you should join Voyis:
Our team is made up of problem-solvers, passionate about pushing the boundaries of what’s possible underwater. We get excited about building cool stuff and working on exciting projects like going to the Titanic (and lots of other shipwrecks too!). Each member of our team makes a significant impact not just on our business, but on our customers as well.
At Voyis, we value diversity and we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all. We thank everyone who applies and for their interest in working for Voyis, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No telephone or walk-in inquiries please. To learn more about life at Voyis, check out
voyis.com
and follow us on
LinkedIn
.

Title: Signal Processing Software Engineer (Autonomous Startup) - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Who is Recruiting from Scratch:
Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.
If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.
Our Client is located in San Carlos, CA. Candidates must be located or willing to relocate to the Bay Area, and/or work Hybrid (one week on/ one week off).
They are stealth startup building perception systems for autonomy. They are based in the Bay Area, funded by a well-known Tier 1 venture firm, and their core team includes faculty entrepreneurs (Stanford and UC Santa Barbara) and veterans from industry (Uber, Apple, Amazon Lab126), who have successfully shepherded signal processing and machine learning innovations to large-scale software for location improvement and safety at Uber, led the development of state-of-the-art computer vision technologies that shipped over millions of Amazon devices, and have delivered zero-to-one product experiences at Uber and Box.
Our client's mission and team expertise span beyond software to advanced sensor systems, embedded systems, signal processing, and machine learning. They currently have an exciting opportunity in the area of signal processing in San Carlos, CA. You will join a multi-disciplinary group of scientists and engineers and will have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional product and research teams. An ideal candidate will have a proven track record of driving zero-to-one innovation for large-scale system projects.
Responsibilities
Integration and optimization of signal processing techniques and algorithms in Python/C++ in production software for embedded systems on the edge.
Handling optimization of advanced signal processing related algorithms such as estimation, detection, prediction, and tracking of people and objects using active depth sensors.
Be involved in all stages of algorithm development including prototyping, data collection, benchmarking, and testing of algorithmic solutions and pipelines.
Design and implementation of benchmarking scripts to evaluate individual algorithms as well as the performance of the full pipeline.
Participate in tuning algorithms to meet performance requirements, including precision and recall.
Optimize various algorithms such that they operate within resource constraints (e.g., CPU / GPU / memory limits).
Own, maintain, and improve software pipelines, including continuous evaluation, gap analysis, benchmarking and fine tuning.
Basic Qualifications
Graduate degree in Electrical or Computer engineering (MSc or PhD).
3+ years of experience in designing and developing Python/C/C++ applications with a focus on signal processing algorithms.
Industry experience deploying at least one signal processing algorithm or pipeline onto production systems.
Prior working experience with at least one active depth sensor (e.g., Time-of-flight sensors, Sonar, Radar, LiDAR, etc.).
Strong fundamental knowledge and skill sets in signal processing, probability theory, fixed-point arithmetic, and numerical methods.
Enjoys taking initiative and working with multidisciplinary teams.
Preferred Qualifications (one or more)
Prior experience with implementing algorithms in embedded systems and GPU optimizations for real-time processing.
Knowledge of advanced signal processing algorithms for depth sensors.
Working experience in one or more the following areas of signal processing:
Theory and algorithms for signal detection and estimation
Algorithm development for sensing and perception for active depth sensors
Localization and tracking algorithms, including Kalman and particle filters
Point cloud processing and filtering
Prior experience developing sensor fusion algorithms using data from different sensing modalities.
3+years of experience with product level development and support.
Cultural Fit
Ability to work in a small and fast-paced environment.
A positive attitude, team-oriented spirit, and enthusiasm for our goals.
A curious outlook - willingness to learn new things and solutions to fit the problem.
A strong sense of ownership and passion for completing a job well - attention to detail.
Ability to work well with all levels of company regardless of seniority.
Sense of humor and ability to proactively problem solve.

Title: Systems Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Systems Engineer
MOLLI Surgical – Toronto
Reports to: Project Manager
Relocation: No
October 2021
At MOLLI Surgical, we believe healthcare needs to get simpler to get better. To achieve this, we focus on learning about the patient experience and developing new medical devices and services that help surgeons and their teams be more efficient and effective. We honour the surgical teams who have dedicated their lives to saving yours.
MOLLI Surgical has operations in the U.S. and Canada, with headquarters in Toronto, Ontario and corporate offices in Deerfield, Illinois. We are led by a commercially experienced team of cancer specialists and healthcare professionals. Founded in partnership with Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre, we create innovative solutions by utilizing easy-to-use and effective technology to deliver a positive patient experience with clinical precision.
As a Systems Engineer at MOLLI Surgical
, you will be an integral part of the engineering team and will drive the development of the next generation of products, while supporting existing products and providing system-level oversight and guidance. You will report to the Project Manager. The short term will be focused on leading the engineering team through product development to regulatory submission, with a focus on systems-level integration and risk management, ensuring our product meets the needs of care teams and patients. The medium term will involve providing leadership to transition from product development to manufacturing. You will collaborate with a cross-functional team including mechanical, electromechanical, software, quality, R&D, operations, manufacturing, and regulatory. The primary work environment will be at a desk, both remote and in-office, with some travel within Canada and the US to customer and supplier sites as permitted by regional travel restrictions and recommendations as well as institutional policies.
We’re looking for the next generation of hustlers and creators. We're searching for candidates that possess self-confidence who know that with the right team, anything is possible. If you believe you have what it takes, MOLLI Surgical has a position for you.
The competitive application includes a cover letter describing adversities and challenges you have overcome through grit and ingenuity alongside your resume and references. Additionally, an innovation portfolio should be provided that highlights some of your fascinating projects.
Responsibilities
Apply a cross-functional/collaborative approach and systems-level thinking to planning, design, development, compliance and launch of MOLLI Surgical devices within ISO 13485, MDSAP and FDA quality systems requirements
Translate care team, patient, market and business requirements into systems requirements/design inputs and specifications
Contribute to the development of the system architecture, subsystems interfaces, interface requirements and behaviours
Plan, coordinate, and own the risk management activities (Hazard analysis, FMEA, risk mitigations, etc.)
Plan, coordinate, and lead the execution of human factors and usability testing activities (formative and summative testing)

Title: Development Operations Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
The Development Operations (DevOps) Engineer role is responsible for the delivery of continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD) process of Porter’s applications. The DevOps Engineer should combine an understanding of both engineering and coding. They should be able to analyse development processes, code and deployment artifacts, and the deployed architecture to devise, implement and manage the process of continuous deployment into both test and production environments.
This role will work closely with the Information Technology and Information Systems teams to merge daily tasks involved in the development, quality control, deployment, and integration of software development into a single, continuous set of processes.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including materials, manpower and time necessary
Provide clear goals for all areas of a project and develop steps to oversee their timely execution
Work closely with engineering professionals within the company to maintain hardware and software needed for projects to be completed efficiently
Mentor and train other engineers throughout the company and seek to continually improve processes companywide
Work alongside project management teams to successfully monitor progress and implementation of initiatives
Analyse current development code repositories and build processes, make recommendations and implement improvements to the deployment processes to align to a modern CI/CD pipeline
Analyse deployed infrastructure to assess the optimal way that applications should be deployed
Manage release deployment process for the FlyPorter web application and any other systems for which a CI/CD process is appropriate
Collaborate with peers within development, quality assurance, technology operations, business analysis and project management to develop and ensure best practices and principles for CI/CD are implemented and followed
Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including time and scope involved
Work with peers in the technical operations team to maintain hardware and software needed for projects to be completed efficiently
Recommend performance enhancements by performing gap analysis, identifying alternative solutions, and assisting with modifications.
Review and maintain all DevOps development work ensuring that technical/functional documentation and solution designs are accurately prepared, maintained, and cataloged.

Title: NOC Technician - Winnipeg, MB - Indeed.com
Description:
Avenir IT Inc. centralizes and manages business technologies for small and medium-sized businesses. Avenir IT Inc. is committed to providing these services based on ethics and honesty to ensure a comfortable, reliable relationship with our clients.
Avenir IT Inc. is currently looking for NOC Technician to join our growing team of geniuses. This pivotal role is to proactively manage and maintain efficient operating states of the network infrastructure, backups and cybersecurity applications, to ensure the business continuity of our clients; and responding to incidents and problems that may impact them.
Who you are: If you have a keen attention to detail, are inquisitive, highly self-managed and motivated with exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, then this is the job for you!
Duties & Responsibilities
As a NOC Technician
You will be responsible for minimizing client downtime by proactively monitoring entire network operations ranging from network infrastructure health to its security concerns.
Responding to automated server and network alerts, efficiently troubleshooting outages, and ensuring servers and network devices are configured to standard.
You will be responsible for managing various types of backup solutions, performing emergency file restores, and performing proactive maintenance on clients’ hardware.
In this role, you will be using existing Remote Monitoring & Management (RMM) software and extending its functionality using scripting and refining procedures
Virtualization Monitoring.
Deployment of Avenir IT toolkit via automation.
Ensuring all servers and workstations are up to date and feature packs are current and error free.
Manage patch approvals.
Installing and monitoring of cybersecurity suite applications
Analyzing Security Information and Event Monitoring (SIEM) platforms and/or log management systems that perform log collection, analysis, correlation, and alerting

Assist Lead NOC Engineer with management and monitoring of implemented solutions.
Prioritize and schedule tickets. Escalate problems (when required) to the appropriately experienced technician.
Record, track and document the help desk request problem-solving process, including all successful and unsuccessful decisions made, and actions taken, through to final resolution.
At least 2+ years’ experience in an IT support role as a Tier 2 Technician.
2+ years’ experience with Windows Systems administration.
2+ years’ experience in a Security Analyst role.
College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science
High-level experience with desktop and server operating systems in Small Business environments.
Configuration and troubleshooting of Office 365 issues, including integration with other services.
Proven experience for monitoring of system reliability and improving performance.
Must have strong scripting / programming (e.g. PowerShell, Batch, Bash) and automation skills.
Thorough knowledge of Active Directory, management and troubleshooting beyond “Users and Computers”.
Knowledge of common network protocols (DNS, DHCP, NTP, SSH) and TCP/IP
Experience with the configuration of networking infrastructure such as VLANs, VPNs and firewalls.
Experience configuring and troubleshooting VPN connections and other remote access solutions.
Experience troubleshooting by reviewing and correlating logs and alerts.
Ability to troubleshoot high-level issues with Windows 7 through Windows 11.
CompTIA A+ level of computer hardware knowledge and familiarity.
Exceptionally strong documentation skills.
Strong English communication skills – written and oral.
Strong French language skills (considered an asset).
Desired Personal Attributes
Desire to always learn and improve.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Keen attention to detail.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Exceptional customer service orientation.
Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and questioning
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Applicants will be invited to complete our online interview questionnaire, which takes about 30 minutes to complete.
Thank you for your interest in Avenir IT, we look forward to speaking with you!

Title: Senior ASIC Verification Engineer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description
An engineering position with Intel of Canada's Intel Optane Group is a challenging but rewarding experience, allowing you to gain knowledge and experience in design and test of IC and module products for the next generation of Solid State Drives (SSDs). As a member of our Controller Hardware Engineering team, you will work alongside experienced engineers to solve new and interesting problems, making an important contribution to our exciting high performance SSD projects.
Data is our future. 90 percent of all data today was created in the last two years and this trend will only accelerate. With the advent of AI, autonomous cars and data science, all of the data infrastructure we have built until now will need to be doubled in the next five years. Can you think of the possibilities?
The Vancouver ASIC team develops SoCs which power next generation Client and Enterprise Optane Solid State Drives (SSDs) and Memory products - a key enablers for our data hungry future. Modern ASICs have grown exponentially more complex in order to enable greater functionality, to push the limits of performance and to use less power. Nevertheless, ASIC verification must absorb and adapt to this growth because high quality ASICs are crucial for success. Our team develops object-oriented models using cutting edge techniques and methodologies which are then simulated and compared against the ASIC.
A Pre-Si verification engineer owns one or more architectural functional blocks to perform all verification related tasks:
Create test plan and develop test bench using UVM methodology.
Develop & advance UVM/Formal-based verification architectures and methodologies
Manage verification regression testing, including results triage and delegating debugging for failed tests
Mentor and coach members of the team
Perform IP and block level coverage driven verification.
Improve existing methodologies to enable effective verification.
Perform Formal Verification, Low Power Verification, Performance Verification, Co-Simulation, Emulation, etc.
We are looking for enthusiastic individual who is willing to do problem-solving, excellent communication and desire to learn. Technically, a solid foundation of digital design (System Verilog) and object-oriented programming is desired but not required. Individual who is looking for a challenging and rewarding work experience should not hesitate to apply
Employees are encouraged to work remotely due to Covid-19, all new hire orientations will be done virtually. This is subject to change and employees deemed as essential workers may be required to work on-site.
Qualifications
Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field.
Minimum Required Qualifications:
6+ years of experience in the following areas:
HDLs and HVL (e.g. SystemVerilog, OVM, UVM, etc.)
Debugging.
Project based teamwork.
Object Oriented Programming experience.
Additional Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree preferred.
Linux experience
Programming Languages: Python, Perl, C and C++, System C
Low Power Verification
Formal Verification
Familiarity with NVMe and PCIe is a highly desired
Working experience with IP/ASIC/SoC block level or top level verification
Inside this Business Group
Non-Volatile Solutions Memory Group: The Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group is a worldwide organization that delivers NAND flash memory products for use in Solid State Drives (SSDs), portable memory storage devices, digital camera memory cards, and other devices. The group is responsible for NVM technology design and development, complete Solid State Drive (SSD) system hardware and firmware development, as well as wafer and SSD manufacturing.
Intel is committed to a culture of accessibility. Intel provides accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Find information and request accommodation here

Title: C++ Software Developer (Vision & Robotics) - Waterloo, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About Voyis:
Voyis designs and manufactures high performance underwater optical sensors (lasers, cameras, lights) for autonomous underwater vehicles that expand capability and enhance understanding in underwater surveys and exploration. Our products have enabled our customers to survey more than 10,000km of ocean floor across all 7 continents, helping people better understand those remote, challenging environments. Our mission is to push the limits of what’s possible subsea and enable every subsea vehicle to see the depths like we see the surface.
Our underwater laser scanners, cameras and lights are proudly designed, engineered, and built in Waterloo, Canada. Voyis operates independently under ownership of Sonardyne Group.
What you’ll do:
As a Software Developer at Voyis you will be developing software for capturing and analysing data from subsea cameras, lasers, and navigation sensors. You will implement image correct and SLAM algorithms and other advanced computer vision tools developed by the R&D team.
We are looking for someone who is eager to learn and work collaboratively with our multidisciplinary engineering team to achieve industry leading results. We are a small team with loads of exciting opportunities where everyone is expected to take ownership and push boundaries in order to achieve our goals, together.
This position will work closely with our sister company EIVA, in Denmark. EIVA is a global leader in subsea data processing and workflow software with 40 software engineers.
Specific responsibilities include:
Developing in C/C++ Linux environment, you will implement stereocamera solutions and SLAM algorithms that use sensor data for underwater awareness and point cloud generation.
Along with a Senior Computer Vision developer - test and implement computer/machine vision algorithms to enable object detection, estimation of pose and position, navigation aiding, and loop closure - all in a challenging underwater environment
Create software tools for repeatable and robust calibration of complex multi-sensor packages using intrinsics and extrinsics
Support and collaborate with broader engineering team and our sister companies to produce reliable and complete product solutions
Write efficient and maintainable code and support others with reviews and test
Occasional field testing (local) and some international travel will be required
Skills you will bring to the table:
Highly proficient in C/C++ programming and debugging. Proven track of writing robust code.
2+ years experience knowledge and experience in full-stack robotics development including
Experience with OpenCV, CUDA, GPU programming
Expeirence with multi-sensor integrations (camera, lidar, INS, GPS, etc) and data processing
Technical degree in Software Development, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related
A positive attitude where you continuously strive for improvement and have the ability to succeed without all the answers
Proven ability to inspire, encourage, and collaborate with your team
Bonus Points for:
Experience working with hardware (embedded computers, cameras, cabling)
Experience with optical systems and image processing
Experience in or a passion for the underwater discovery and robotics
The Perks:
Flexible work hours, plenty of vacation, and a dedication to a well-rounded work-life balance
Generous employee-directed personal education funds to drive continuous learning
Profit-sharing to celebrate our successes together
Regular company-wide social events (even remotely!)
Health and vision benefits
Why you should join Voyis:
Our team is made up of problem-solvers, passionate about pushing the boundaries of what’s possible underwater. We get excited about building cool stuff and working on exciting projects like going to the Titanic (and lots of other shipwrecks too!). Each member of our team makes a significant impact not just on our business, but on our customers as well.
At Voyis, we value diversity and we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all. We thank everyone who applies and for their interest in working for Voyis, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No telephone or walk-in inquiries please. To learn more about life at Voyis, check out
voyis.com
and follow us on
LinkedIn
.

Title: Signal Processing Software Engineer (Autonomous Startup) - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Who is Recruiting from Scratch:
Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.
If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.
Our Client is located in San Carlos, CA. Candidates must be located or willing to relocate to the Bay Area, and/or work Hybrid (one week on/ one week off).
They are stealth startup building perception systems for autonomy. They are based in the Bay Area, funded by a well-known Tier 1 venture firm, and their core team includes faculty entrepreneurs (Stanford and UC Santa Barbara) and veterans from industry (Uber, Apple, Amazon Lab126), who have successfully shepherded signal processing and machine learning innovations to large-scale software for location improvement and safety at Uber, led the development of state-of-the-art computer vision technologies that shipped over millions of Amazon devices, and have delivered zero-to-one product experiences at Uber and Box.
Our client's mission and team expertise span beyond software to advanced sensor systems, embedded systems, signal processing, and machine learning. They currently have an exciting opportunity in the area of signal processing in San Carlos, CA. You will join a multi-disciplinary group of scientists and engineers and will have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional product and research teams. An ideal candidate will have a proven track record of driving zero-to-one innovation for large-scale system projects.
Responsibilities
Integration and optimization of signal processing techniques and algorithms in Python/C++ in production software for embedded systems on the edge.
Handling optimization of advanced signal processing related algorithms such as estimation, detection, prediction, and tracking of people and objects using active depth sensors.
Be involved in all stages of algorithm development including prototyping, data collection, benchmarking, and testing of algorithmic solutions and pipelines.
Design and implementation of benchmarking scripts to evaluate individual algorithms as well as the performance of the full pipeline.
Participate in tuning algorithms to meet performance requirements, including precision and recall.
Optimize various algorithms such that they operate within resource constraints (e.g., CPU / GPU / memory limits).
Own, maintain, and improve software pipelines, including continuous evaluation, gap analysis, benchmarking and fine tuning.
Basic Qualifications
Graduate degree in Electrical or Computer engineering (MSc or PhD).
3+ years of experience in designing and developing Python/C/C++ applications with a focus on signal processing algorithms.
Industry experience deploying at least one signal processing algorithm or pipeline onto production systems.
Prior working experience with at least one active depth sensor (e.g., Time-of-flight sensors, Sonar, Radar, LiDAR, etc.).
Strong fundamental knowledge and skill sets in signal processing, probability theory, fixed-point arithmetic, and numerical methods.
Enjoys taking initiative and working with multidisciplinary teams.
Preferred Qualifications (one or more)
Prior experience with implementing algorithms in embedded systems and GPU optimizations for real-time processing.
Knowledge of advanced signal processing algorithms for depth sensors.
Working experience in one or more the following areas of signal processing:
Theory and algorithms for signal detection and estimation
Algorithm development for sensing and perception for active depth sensors
Localization and tracking algorithms, including Kalman and particle filters
Point cloud processing and filtering
Prior experience developing sensor fusion algorithms using data from different sensing modalities.
3+years of experience with product level development and support.
Cultural Fit
Ability to work in a small and fast-paced environment.
A positive attitude, team-oriented spirit, and enthusiasm for our goals.
A curious outlook - willingness to learn new things and solutions to fit the problem.
A strong sense of ownership and passion for completing a job well - attention to detail.
Ability to work well with all levels of company regardless of seniority.
Sense of humor and ability to proactively problem solve.

Relocation: No
October 2021
At MOLLI Surgical, we believe healthcare needs to get simpler to get better. To achieve this, we focus on learning about the patient experience and developing new medical devices and services that help surgeons and their teams be more efficient and effective. We honour the surgical teams who have dedicated their lives to saving yours.
MOLLI Surgical has operations in the U.S. and Canada, with headquarters in Toronto, Ontario and corporate offices in Deerfield, Illinois. We are led by a commercially experienced team of cancer specialists and healthcare professionals. Founded in partnership with Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre, we create innovative solutions by utilizing easy-to-use and effective technology to deliver a positive patient experience with clinical precision.
As a Systems Engineer at MOLLI Surgical
, you will be an integral part of the engineering team and will drive the development of the next generation of products, while supporting existing products and providing system-level oversight and guidance. You will report to the Project Manager. The short term will be focused on leading the engineering team through product development to regulatory submission, with a focus on systems-level integration and risk management, ensuring our product meets the needs of care teams and patients. The medium term will involve providing leadership to transition from product development to manufacturing. You will collaborate with a cross-functional team including mechanical, electromechanical, software, quality, R&D, operations, manufacturing, and regulatory. The primary work environment will be at a desk, both remote and in-office, with some travel within Canada and the US to customer and supplier sites as permitted by regional travel restrictions and recommendations as well as institutional policies.
We’re looking for the next generation of hustlers and creators. We're searching for candidates that possess self-confidence who know that with the right team, anything is possible. If you believe you have what it takes, MOLLI Surgical has a position for you.
The competitive application includes a cover letter describing adversities and challenges you have overcome through grit and ingenuity alongside your resume and references. Additionally, an innovation portfolio should be provided that highlights some of your fascinating projects.
Responsibilities
Apply a cross-functional/collaborative approach and systems-level thinking to planning, design, development, compliance and launch of MOLLI Surgical devices within ISO 13485, MDSAP and FDA quality systems requirements
Translate care team, patient, market and business requirements into systems requirements/design inputs and specifications
Contribute to the development of the system architecture, subsystems interfaces, interface requirements and behaviours
Plan, coordinate, and own the risk management activities (Hazard analysis, FMEA, risk mitigations, etc.)
Plan, coordinate, and lead the execution of human factors and usability testing activities (formative and summative testing)
Work with the team to develop the verification and validation (V&V) plan and support the development and execution of V&V protocols
Develop technical documentation of the product (Design History File, Device Master Records) and maintain traceability
Lead and participate in design reviews, phase reviews, post-market reviews and brainstorming sessions
Manage and coordinate external testing with testing labs (biocompatibility, sterilization, electrical safety, EMI, etc.)
Assemble and test prototypes and products
Contribute to the continuous improvement and application of systems engineering processes, best practices and tools
Provide guidance on the use and application of various medical device standards to team
Lead the design transfer to manufacturing activities and liaise with suppliers/contract manufacturers
Assist with sustaining activities such as investigating issues arising from the field (CAPAs, nonconformances, etc.)
What We're Looking For
Bachelor degree in Engineering (Systems, Biomedical, Mechanical or equivalent)
4+ years of experience in systems engineering related role on products involving both hardware and software preferably in medical devices (or similar regulated industry)
Strong working knowledge of risk management, verification and validation protocols and requirements for electrical, biocompatibility, sterility and human factors
Understanding of ISO 13485, ISO14971, IEC 62366, IEC 623304, IEC 60601
Experience with eQMS/PLM systems, such as Arena
Bold creativity and an indomitable spirit towards problem-solving
Someone who thrives in a fast-paced, energetic environment
Ability to engage a team through excellent written and oral communication
Self-starter who is comfortable with autonomy and operates with a focus on action-biased outcomes
Exceptional level of accountability and integrity
Exemplifies Our Values (see below)
Nice to Haves
Experience in Healthcare or medical device industry
Proficiency in computer skills including G-Suite and Microsoft

team of leaders
that believe in:

people
first, always.

.

Title: Development Operations Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
The Development Operations (DevOps) Engineer role is responsible for the delivery of continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD) process of Porter’s applications. The DevOps Engineer should combine an understanding of both engineering and coding. They should be able to analyse development processes, code and deployment artifacts, and the deployed architecture to devise, implement and manage the process of continuous deployment into both test and production environments.
This role will work closely with the Information Technology and Information Systems teams to merge daily tasks involved in the development, quality control, deployment, and integration of software development into a single, continuous set of processes.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyze current technology utilized within the company and develop steps and processes to improve and expand upon them
Establish milestones for necessary contributions from departments and develop processes to facilitate their collaboration
Assist other department engineers in creating practical demonstrations of proposed solutions and demonstrating them to other members of the team
Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including materials, manpower and time necessary
Provide clear goals for all areas of a project and develop steps to oversee their timely execution
Work closely with engineering professionals within the company to maintain hardware and software needed for projects to be completed efficiently
Mentor and train other engineers throughout the company and seek to continually improve processes companywide
Work alongside project management teams to successfully monitor progress and implementation of initiatives
Analyse current development code repositories and build processes, make recommendations and implement improvements to the deployment processes to align to a modern CI/CD pipeline
Analyse deployed infrastructure to assess the optimal way that applications should be deployed
Manage release deployment process for the FlyPorter web application and any other systems for which a CI/CD process is appropriate
Collaborate with peers within development, quality assurance, technology operations, business analysis and project management to develop and ensure best practices and principles for CI/CD are implemented and followed
Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including time and scope involved
Work with peers in the technical operations team to maintain hardware and software needed for projects to be completed efficiently
Recommend performance enhancements by performing gap analysis, identifying alternative solutions, and assisting with modifications.
Review and maintain all DevOps development work ensuring that technical/functional documentation and solution designs are accurately prepared, maintained, and cataloged.
Act as a point of contact for technical and functional issues as well as high priority requests.
Actively investigate new DevOps technologies and make recommendations to management regarding best practices, system reliability and performance and find cost-effective solutions
BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES:
Concern for Safety:
Identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others.
Teamwork:
Working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals.
Passenger/Customer Service:
Providing service excellence to internal customers
Initiative:
Dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise.
Results Focus:
Focusing efforts on achieving high quality results consistent with the organization’s standards.
Fostering Communication:
Listening and communicating openly, honestly, and respectfully with different audiences, promoting dialogue and building consensus.
Exemplifying Integrity:
Treating others fairly, honestly, and respectfully, furthering the integrity of the organization and its relationships of trust with team members and the broader community.
Inspiring Others:
Energizing and inspiring others to strive for excellence and commit to common goals and purposes, creating a sense of self-efficacy, resilience, and persistence in followers.
Leading Change:
Recognizing the need for change, being open to new ideas and methods, and championing transformational change within the organization and beyond.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or engineering (or equivalent) preferred.
3+ years technology experience with hands-on Sysop and DevOps experience.
Strong knowledge and experience with Agile methodology and/or an established release protocol.
Experience with working on multiple concurrent developments in a fast pace environment.
Experience developing engineering applications for a large corporation
Current understanding of best practices regarding system security measures
Proven ability to implement and execute on DevOps processes in other companies
Proven experience developing CI/CD solutions using a Microsoft .NET software stack and Microsoft server technologies
Demonstrated experience with microservices architecture
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or Software Engineering is preferred
Professional experience and a high-level understanding of working with various operating systems and their implications
Advanced and creative problem solving skills.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to understand and communicate the business impact of technical issues.
Experience collaborating with application development teams, project managers, application and enterprise architects, application technical leads, vendor partners (both onsite and offshore), and other application development teams.
Curious and inquisitive with strong analytic and decision making abilities.
Motivated and self-starter.
TECHNICAL SKILLS:
Full stack experience in all stages of the software development life cycle including architecture, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
Experience with Amazon Web Services
Experience with source control management systems and continuous integration/deployment environments, preferably using Bitbucket with GIT.
Knowledge of configuration management and development tools
Experience with microservices architecture
Experience in a Microsoft environment, including PowerShell scripting, configuring IIS, MS SQL, scheduled tasks, services, etc.
Experience in a Linux environment including bash scripting, nginx, RabbitMQ, Redis
Experience with issue tracking and resolution systems such as JIRA.
Experience with change process management.

Title: Onsite -Desktop Support Technician - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Role – Desktop Support Technician
Job Summary
Desktop Technician will provide day to day local remote desktop support, receive inbound calls,
answer questions, troubleshoot and document steps performed to resolve challenges with hardware,
software and application issues in a ticketing system. The candidate will also need to facilitate
customer resolution for calls and engage their supervisors and managers to ensure operational
consistency across all shifts within the IT Support Center. Desktop Support Engineer provides Break
Fix, fault diagnosis and resolution. Providing fault analysis to customer’s various core operating
systems and platforms, as well be able to provide support and apply desktop fault resolution for the
approved application suite. Ideal candidate should have relevant 2-3 years’ experience in Windows
Desktop support.
a) Provide first/second level contact and problem resolution for customer issues.
b) Work with Third Party Vendors to remediate complex AV issues as needed.
c) Provide timely communication on issue status and resolution.
d) Maintain ticket updates for all reported incidents.
e) Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot XP, Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 and
Microsoft Office 2010, Cisco Jabber, another authorized desktop application.
f) Should have basic knowledge of Mac operating system, to support Apple pc users.
g) Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot for printers, computer hardware.
h) Performs general preventative maintenance tasks on computers, laptops, printers.
i) Performs remedial repairs on Desktops, laptops, printers and any other authorized peripheral
equipment.
j) Use diagnostic tools to troubleshoot problems associated with network connectivity, and
workstation hardware/software.
k) Broad experience of IT with basic understanding of Networks, Servers, Audio/Visual, Smart
Devices and Telecoms.
l) This position requires the ability to work in a project-based environment requiring flexibility and
teamwork. Performs other duties as assigned.
Candidate Required Minimum Qualifications and Skills
a) Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field.
b) CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) or better.
c) Minimum of 18 months years of IT experience.
d) Windows 7-10, Microsoft Active Directory, utilization of GPOs, MS Office 365, PC hardware
installation and troubleshooting, Enterprise anti-virus solutions, Helpdesk ticketing systems.
e) Mobile device management including IOS and Android devices, Enterprise encryption solutions,
Windows PC/laptop management via Active Directory.
f) Proven analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
g) Proven ability to multi-task, effectively determine priorities and meet SLA’s.
h) Excellent communication relationship-building and internal customer service skills.
i) Adaptable and flexible in a fast-changing industry and work environment.
j) Willing to work off-hours and weekends when required for projects or emergency support.

Title: New Grad: Routing/IP Software Engineer - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Since 1992, Ciena has been driven by a relentless pursuit of network innovation. We believe in a network that grows smarter, more agile, and more responsive every day. This means that when you digitally interact in your world - picking up the phone, streaming video, texting a friend or loved one – your interactions are being enabled by Ciena technologies. Ciena makes your social / entertainment / business existence REAL.
What will you do at Ciena?
The Packet Software group is seeking entry level software designers to join our team of embedded software development professionals. The successful candidate will design, code and support software drivers, APIs and/or data plane applications written in C/C++ and running in a real-time embedded Linux environment, to support advanced Layer 2/3 services on customized delivery platforms. This involves working closely with advanced hardware devices including multi-core embedded CPUs, FPGAs, L2/L3 switch ASICs and 10G/100G Ethernet PHYs and optics.
Responsibilities
Develop embedded software running under Linux on carrier-grade L2/L3 service delivery and aggregation platforms, including development of new features, enhancements to existing features and support for new hardware platforms
Work collaboratively in all stages of the software development process, including requirements analysis, functional specification, design, coding, integration, verification and support
Contribute to the bring-up of new hardware products, providing device drivers and configuring ASICs/FPGAs/PHYs to establish functional end-to-end data path
Participate in Agile Scrum team to complete assigned stories in prescribed sprints
Desired Traits
Enthusiastic and innovative software designer
Self motivated
Problem solver
Good communicator
Team player
Required Skills and Experience
Bachelors degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent. Masters degree is considered an asset but not required.
Proficiency in C/C++ programming language and basic understanding of embedded software development concepts
Experience using Linux as a development platform and/or embedded OS, preferably on x86/ARM target processors
Familiarity with the following would be an asset: GIT, Perforce, Python (or other scripting languages), Yocto, REST, GDB, JIRA
Exposure to modern L1/L2/L3 networking standards and protocols is also an asset

Title: Performance Analyst Intern - Winter 2022 - Canada - Indeed.com
Description:
NVIDIA is a worldwide technology company headquartered in Santa Clara, California. NVIDIA manufactures graphics processing units (GPUs), as well as system on a chip units (SOCs) for the expanding markets. Our work in visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics, has led to thousands of patented inventions, breakthrough technologies, deep industry relationships and a globally recognized brand. Our work opens up new universes to explore, enables amazing creativity and discovery, and powers inventions such as artificial intelligence and autonomous cars
As a
Performance Analyst intern
, you will interact closely with fellow analysts/engineers and the development team to evaluate and improve the company's products, execute test plans, report issues, run/build automation scripts, and other tools to provide analytical information and ensure the robustness of the applications and technologies being developed. We are looking for highly motivated PC gamers with a strong technical background who want to contribute to the testing and development of cutting edge technologies and applications! You would join the team responsible for the maintenance, development, and execution of Performance Testing for the world's fastest, power efficient GPUs.
What you'll be doing:
Work closely with senior analysts/engineers as part of a dedicated team to deliver high-quality Game software products
Build, setup, and configure computer systems with appropriate hardware and software to run benchmarks on various systems
Effectively execute test cases across multiple platforms including but not limited to: Windows, Linux and VR devices
Run performance, image quality, stability and other tests of PC games and benchmark applications on various GPUs/CPUs
Develop and improve automation scripts
Analyze and validate results from test runs and create reports that will be used across multiple teams (HW/SW/Producers/Marketing)
Identify, reproduce and provide informed insight on bugs
Communicate status and issues across teams internally and externally
Design, develop and execute reusable test plans, ensure effective coverage of test cases to improve user perceived quality of the product
Investigate and implement new testing methods to improve process efficiency
Assess product quality and provide feedback to management to facilitate release decisions
What we need to see:
Currently pursuing degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field
A deep knowledge, interest, and experience in variety of game titles in a wide range of genres
Multi-platform expertise ranging from Windows, Linux, Mac with an understanding of operating systems, processors, and GPUs
Passionate PC gamer with a proven understanding of in-game settings and graphics technologies
Good knowledge of PC systems and components, ability to build, maintain and debug test machines
Strong skills in benchmarking and competitive analysis
Excellent communication, teamwork, and interpersonal skills
High attention to detail and a real passion for user experience
Familiarity with bug tracking tools such as JIRA
Demonstrates analytical, problem-solving, time management, and organizational skills
Ability to work independently, think creatively and adapt to changing priorities
Ways to Stand Out From The Crowd:
Experience in similar role with focus on games
Scripting and automation expertise in Python
Knowledge of NVIDIA GeForce series, software products ( GeForce Experience, GeForce Now, NVIDIA Broadcast ) and technologies
With competitive salaries and a generous benefits package, we are widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working for us and, due to unprecedented growth, our elite performance teams are rapidly growing. If you are a passionate PC gamer with a sharp eye for detail and desire for continuous learning, we want to hear from you.

Title: Senior IT Unified Communications and Network Engineer - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
At Chartwell, we’re all about Making People’s Lives Better for our residents, their families, and our employees. Join an exceptional group of diverse, caring, and passionate people who are inspired to make a difference in their own lives and are dedicated to delivering an experience that is personalized, memorable and feels like home for more than 30,000 residents across the country.
The Senior IT Unified Communications & Network Engineer is responsible for design, implementation and operation of a distributed unified communications infrastructure including corporate offices and remote locations. This role will maintain the ongoing reliability, performance, and support of the current infrastructure by monitoring the operating environments for potential issues; responding to escalated incidents and problems; planning for growth and continuously improving the Company’s operating environment.
The responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to the following:
Develop and build a Unified Communications infrastructure solution from the ground up according with business requirements and provide continuous improvements to keep up with changes in business and technology.
Design, install and configure complex solutions including Voice, Video, Chat, Presence, Conferencing, Contact Center to satisfy business requirements.
Implement and support highly available and scalable Unified Communications solutions across many remote locations.
Integrate a dynamic and complex UC environment with 3rd party solutions and applications.
Integrate and connect with multiple telecom providers.
Configure and manage dial plans, UC applications, Telepresence systems and Conferencing platforms.
Implement, manage and support call center solutions.
Design and configure voice and video over LAN, WAN and Wi-Fi.
Implement reliability strategies to maintain call quality and survivability.
Integrate multi-vendor phone systems to provide easy to use solutions for the business.
Manage infrastructure effectively at all locations through standardization and automation.
Configure and manage monitoring as well as event management and automatic remediation.
Work closely with cyber security team to implement policies and best practices and be proactive on remediating vulnerabilities.
Create and maintain documentation, including standards, diagrams, drawings and deployment plans.
Provide Unified Communications metrics for team and executive reporting.
Advise management on hardware and software capacity and lifecycle management.
Develop proposals for introducing new technologies in alignment with the future direction of Chartwell.
Gather business requirements working directly with business representatives, vendors and others in ITS, as appropriate, to help devise the required solution.
Research new technologies solutions with a focus on solving potential problems as opposed to solving existing problems.
Provide Unified Communications solutions based on business needs and anticipated growth.
Working across all functional areas of the ITS Environment, ensure all escalated service requests and incidents are resolved in a professional and timely manner.
Participate in incident, problem and change management processes as well as lessons learned with focus on continuous improvements.
Escalate and manage vendors, partners and service providers and to provide timely resolution to problems.
Share expertise and provide individual training and support.
Stay abreast of new and emerging technologies to drive the IT innovation within Chartwell.
Comply with all IT and corporate policies and with the guidance of the IT Security team, ensure that all audit controls are met.
Comply with any project management requirements such as documentation standards and status reporting as determined by the manager.
The ideal candidate will possess:
University degree in a relevant field of study
Preference is given to a candidate with technical certifications (CCNP, CCIE, ITIL)
Minimum 7-10 years of progressive IT experience, working in a complex environment with many distributed sites.
Advanced expertise with large Unified Communications environments, concepts and technologies
Expert knowledge of Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM), Unity Connections (Unity), Cisco Telepresence, Unified Contact Center Express (UCCX), WebEx, Expressway/VCS
Expert knowledge of UC applications including Cisco Jabber and Cisco WebEx Teams
Experience in building and supporting large scale deployment over WAN with site survivability (SRST/SRSV)
Expert knowledge of Cisco Voice Gateways including SIP, H.323, PRI, FXS/FXO, CUBE
Expert knowledge of VoIP protocols.
Expert knowledge and experience with IP networks including IPAM, DHCP, DNS
Knowledge of Communications Manager Express (CUCME)
Advanced knowledge in Cisco IOS, IOS-XE and NX-OS
Advanced knowledge of branch technologies including Cisco ISR 4400
Expert knowledge in diagnosing complex network performance issues and working with Network Monitoring systems, Wireshark, IPPERF, NETFLOW, IP SLA and other network troubleshooting/performance benchmarking techniques
Good knowledge of Avaya IP-Office and one-X (Communicator & Mobile)
Advanced knowledge of LAN, WAN technologies
Good understanding of information security best practices.
Excellent customer service skills, positive attitude.
Resourceful and collaborative.
Excellent organizational & multitasking skills.
Quick learner.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Strong team player.
Bilingual in French and English, an asset
Work requires mental effort, such as attentiveness and/or concentration, verifying, checking numbers, watching a computer screen and physical effort, such as keyboarding.
Work is generally performed in an office environment.
Occasional travel to remote sites (up to 10%)
Occasional need to work outside of office hours

Title: Automation and Maintenance Engineer/Specialist- Mississauga & Oakville - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Reporting to the Reliability Maintenanace Manager, the Automation and Maintenance (A/M) Engineer/Specialist will provide leadership in the implementation, support, and functioning of site maintenance systems and PLC-based control/PC-based supervisory systems at the Mississauga Board Plant and Oakville Finishing. Specific focus will be placed on ensuring the maintenance activities of the plant are achieving plant targets continuous improvement processes are being carried out.
Accountabilities include:
Maintain a safe working environment. Must recognize unsafe conditions and practices and make corrections to prevent injuries and property loss. Required to support or complete safety audits/inspections of the assigned work area, thorough investigations of incidents and accidents, job safety analysis and have periodic safety meetings.
Oversee maintenance function of the plant, parts, equipment, monitor and report improvement and preventative maintenance objectives.
Communicate with all CertainTeed employees to build trust and effective teamwork.
Monitor and review maintenance work requirements and results, co-ordinate use of contractors and ensure maintenance activities are maintained and continuous improvements evaluated.
Active support for and involvement in the WCM processes consistent with Plant, Automation and Maintenance objectives
Monitor production processes and product quality to ensure correct procedures are followed for quality production, and oversee employee training for operators and maintenance personnel.
Evaluate source of equipment problems (troubleshooting), and utilize WCM techniques to achieve operational targets.
Technical support and enhancement of PLC-based production control systems and supervisory/SCADA systems, Plant data communication networks, and other automation issues.
Identify new opportunities and solutions with cost/benefit analysis, implement Best Practices.
Coordinate automation projects with responsibility for technical content, budgeting, cost management and on-time completion and effective ultimate functionality.
Prepare RFQ’s adjudicate the responses and manage contractor resources.
Ensure full documentation of all projects and systems, as actually built.
Other duties and projects as required.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Engineer will have an electrical engineering degree and carry a Professional Engineering designation to practice professional engineering in the province. Specialist will have an Electrical engineering degree or college diploma or equivalent industry experience.
Minimum of five years experience in development and implementation of PC-based supervisory and PLC-control systems.
Technical knowledge of maintenance manufacturing activities, ability to monitor and make recommendations for maintenance and related equipment and process improvements.
Experience in electrical, process control, instrumentation, automation, and computer and data communication systems.
Understanding of integrated automation and information systems in a manufacturing environment. Previous experience working in a continuous process industry is a necessity.
Ability to program Allen-Bradley and Modicon PLC’s and Intellution FIX and Wonderware PC-based supervisory systems. Ability to specify and set up said systems’ hardware, software, data communications and fieldbus networks.
Familiarity with variable speed drives and servo systems.
Experienced with National Electrical Code (NEC) and Arc-Flash (NFPA-70) code requirements.
Understands Burner Flames Safety controls (NFPA-86) combustion controls
Team player with good interpersonal, communication and customer service skills to operate effectively in a team environment.
Innovative and able to demonstrate initiative.
Leadership abilities and ability to make independent decisions when required.
Who are we ?
Through the responsible development of innovative and sustainable building products,
CertainTeed
, headquartered in Malvern, Pennsylvania, has helped shape the building products industry for more than 110 years. Founded in 1904 as General Roofing Manufacturing Company, the firm's slogan "Quality Made Certain, Satisfaction Guaranteed," inspired the name CertainTeed. Today, CertainTeed is a leading North American brand of exterior and interior building products, including roofing, siding, fence, decking, railing, trim, insulation, drywall and ceilings.
A subsidiary of Saint-Gobain, one of the world’s largest and oldest building products companies, CertainTeed has more than 6,300 employees and more than 60 manufacturing facilities throughout the United States and Canada. www.certainteed.com
Legal Statement
Saint-Gobain is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to applicants upon their request. This commitment is in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Title: C++ Software Developer (Vision & Robotics) - Waterloo, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About Voyis:
Voyis designs and manufactures high performance underwater optical sensors (lasers, cameras, lights) for autonomous underwater vehicles that expand capability and enhance understanding in underwater surveys and exploration. Our products have enabled our customers to survey more than 10,000km of ocean floor across all 7 continents, helping people better understand those remote, challenging environments. Our mission is to push the limits of what’s possible subsea and enable every subsea vehicle to see the depths like we see the surface.
Our underwater laser scanners, cameras and lights are proudly designed, engineered, and built in Waterloo, Canada. Voyis operates independently under ownership of Sonardyne Group.
What you’ll do:
As a Software Developer at Voyis you will be developing software for capturing and analysing data from subsea cameras, lasers, and navigation sensors. You will implement image correct and SLAM algorithms and other advanced computer vision tools developed by the R&D team.
We are looking for someone who is eager to learn and work collaboratively with our multidisciplinary engineering team to achieve industry leading results. We are a small team with loads of exciting opportunities where everyone is expected to take ownership and push boundaries in order to achieve our goals, together.
This position will work closely with our sister company EIVA, in Denmark. EIVA is a global leader in subsea data processing and workflow software with 40 software engineers.
Specific responsibilities include:
Developing in C/C++ Linux environment, you will implement stereocamera solutions and SLAM algorithms that use sensor data for underwater awareness and point cloud generation.
Along with a Senior Computer Vision developer - test and implement computer/machine vision algorithms to enable object detection, estimation of pose and position, navigation aiding, and loop closure - all in a challenging underwater environment
Create software tools for repeatable and robust calibration of complex multi-sensor packages using intrinsics and extrinsics
Support and collaborate with broader engineering team and our sister companies to produce reliable and complete product solutions
Write efficient and maintainable code and support others with reviews and test
Occasional field testing (local) and some international travel will be required
Skills you will bring to the table:
Highly proficient in C/C++ programming and debugging. Proven track of writing robust code.
2+ years experience knowledge and experience in full-stack robotics development including
Experience with OpenCV, CUDA, GPU programming
Expeirence with multi-sensor integrations (camera, lidar, INS, GPS, etc) and data processing
Technical degree in Software Development, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related
A positive attitude where you continuously strive for improvement and have the ability to succeed without all the answers
Proven ability to inspire, encourage, and collaborate with your team
Bonus Points for:
Experience working with hardware (embedded computers, cameras, cabling)
Experience with optical systems and image processing
Experience in or a passion for the underwater discovery and robotics
The Perks:
Flexible work hours, plenty of vacation, and a dedication to a well-rounded work-life balance
Generous employee-directed personal education funds to drive continuous learning
Profit-sharing to celebrate our successes together
Regular company-wide social events (even remotely!)
Health and vision benefits
Why you should join Voyis:
Our team is made up of problem-solvers, passionate about pushing the boundaries of what’s possible underwater. We get excited about building cool stuff and working on exciting projects like going to the Titanic (and lots of other shipwrecks too!). Each member of our team makes a significant impact not just on our business, but on our customers as well.
At Voyis, we value diversity and we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all. We thank everyone who applies and for their interest in working for Voyis, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No telephone or walk-in inquiries please. To learn more about life at Voyis, check out
voyis.com
and follow us on
LinkedIn
.

Title: Software Engineer - Contract - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Have you heard of BlueCat?
We’re one of those hidden gems that’s been disrupting the market as a key player in the rapidly growing space of Adaptive DNS. We harness the power of DNS to provide secure, centralized network infrastructure to some of the world’s biggest brands and enterprises like Facebook, Apple, Dell, and SAP so that employees can access the computing resources they need, when they need it. After years of experience, we moved into the security market, leveraging that goldmine of DNS data to help organizations protect their internal networks.
Right now you’re thinking ‘Great, so why is that interesting to me?’ Here’s why:
BlueCat occupies an incredibly strategic and valuable real estate on corporate networks – the ‘first step’ taken when any device, application or service connects to a network. We literally own the intersection of digital business and cybersecurity – and that translates into incalculable opportunities for innovation and growth.
The BlueCat Product team prides ourselves on being a diverse team with innovation at our core. The delivery of quality products is our mission. We strive to deliver by using agile methodologies; our team works to make an impact and are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges. At BlueCat our core values are the foundation of our culture of fun, we win as a team and value employees who have the courage to act and to make an impact every day.
BlueCat seeks a driven, results-oriented
Software Engineer
for a 12 month contract.
What you bring to the team
:
Fluent in one language & happy working predominantly in Java along with C++ and Python
Interest in full stack development, from working with UI, API and business logic to optimizing database transactions
Versatile development mindset with the ability and desire to pick up different languages, frameworks and techniques with ease
Interest working with DNS, DHCP and networking
Interest working with a product that’s deployed on multiple architectures & cloud environments
What you are responsible for
:
Contribute to the development and design of BlueCat’s solutions in an agile team environment
Write high quality, testable and maintainable code that satisfies customers needs
Collaborate with other engineers, architects and stakeholders to drive the product forward
Participate in product discussions, influence the development roadmap and take ownership and responsibility over projects to make them happen
Skills and Experiences Required:
Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a closely related field
5+ years of solid commercial software development experience
Strong software development skills and computer science fundamentals
Comfortable working with large, complex codebases and understand the challenges around moving them forward
BlueCat’s core values are:
Curiosity - We care and inquire about the challenges and needs of our customers.
Clarity - We keep communication crisp, clear, and responsive.
Collaboration - We win with each other, never alone.
Transparency - We ensure all relevant information is available – no questions are off limits.
Ownership - We are responsible and accountable for getting things done.
What you’ll get from us:
Fast growth for BlueCat means fast growth for you! With the world’s biggest and hottest logos as our clients, we are a well-established business that still operates with the fun culture of a start-up. We get to work hard and still have all the fun without all the risk! Experienced leaders make sure we keep going to the moon and beyond.
While we’re growing together, we’ll have your back with solid compensation/bonuses, education budgets, corporate discount for gym memberships for you and your family, daily discounted breakfasts and lunches catered from all over the city, record breaking sales quarters, team and company socials, choice of hardware, flexible hours, hackathons, and a company culture that values curiosity, clarity, collaboration, transparency and ownership. All this in a beautiful office in Toronto, with easy access to transit on the Yonge line.
Joining BlueCat means you’ll be joining a company that’s been certified as a Great Place to Work for the fifth year in a row! In addition to that, we’ve been included in the 2020 lists for the Best Workplaces for Inclusion and Best Workplaces for Women.
If you’re as excited about the future of our company as we are, we would love to hear from you!
Accommodations will be provided throughout the recruitment, hiring and employment process in accordance with the AODA and the Ontario Human Rights Code.

At Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), we build the future of the cloud for Enterprises as a diverse team of fellow creators and inventors. We act with the speed and attitude of a start-up, the scale and customer focus of the leading enterprise software company in the world.
Values are OCI’s foundation and how we deliver excellence. We strive for equity, inclusion, and respect for all. We are committed to the greater good in our products and our actions. Title: Engineer I-Applications - Mont-royal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Description
Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM).
